Jill.text:
You have no idea how long I've wanted 
some curry.

I remember I meant to eat some, but 
then I had to pay for some drinks I 
spilled on the floor.

Yeah, about that. Mind if I ask 
something? Mister... Timothy Mercury.

It's a small city. Turns out two very 
grateful girls soon became regulars and 
both of them were related to you.

The first one is, why did they brand 
you as a traitor? Because you killed the 
other guy?

I don't know. It sounds weird 
considering the other guy assaulted two 
little girls.

That's all I needed to know. Sorry for 
bringing that up.

Yeah. How did you build this restaurant 
so fast?

Heh... those two are really nice girls, 
huh?

Wow, I've never seen her so openly 
excited before.
You sure you don't mind me?

Really nice girl... If a bit oblivious 
to the risk some people represent.
She doesn't mind stalkers and such.
Just what transpired inside that bank?
You want to be a vigilante, then?

I have enough problems with just 
one, you know?

With just listening to one of your 
anecdotes.

You told me about the Neo-Tijuana 
thing, and now this. Don't you have a 
more... subdued story?

I can't believe you actually made me 
do that sleepover thing.
You're talking too much, little girl.

U-Um... OW! Just what are you doing 
with my hair?

Ass. What this girl is trying to say is 
that with your tits and ass, you could build 
a Lenore and a half out of the mass.

I'm not worried about him, I'm worried 
about me!

I've never been away from Fore this 
long. I don't what I'll do!
Sigh. To think I'd be evicted...

I... was two months late already, 
actually.

Thanks for letting me stay here by 
the -- WHOA! Your bed is huge!

I haven't slept in a mattress in... 
fuck, over two years now.

(Having her hug me certainly doesn't 
help.)

(I don't wanna wake her up either, 
she looks so comfortable right now.)

(I wonder if Boss would've let me 
crash in her place.)

(Oh well, let's just try to sleep a 
bit and...)

(No, you piece of fur don't you 
dare sleep on my fa-...)

Don't you think taunting me for 
serving "easy drinks" of all things 
is too much?

She's going to make such a ruckus when 
she wakes up. You know that.

You can't just push that responsibility 
onto us! We have work to do, damn it!

Nah, that's unlikely. She'd be 
crowing about it or taunting us if that 
were the case.

And it's not like her to pick on such 
a small girl... at least not unprovoked.

Yes, I'll start working while YOU go 
clean the bathroom.

While you spent the whole weekend and 
Monday doing god-knows-what, we've had some 
interesting clients come in.

Gil, you've known me for how long now? 
Do I look like the kind of woman who would 
make a joke like that?

So! As punishment for leaving me to 
deal with all of that on my lonesome, you'll 
be in charge of cleaning the bathrooms.

(With that out of the way, let's 
play some music on the new "Jukebox".)

(This model needs to have all of its 
12 slots filled with songs before it can 
start.)

(I wonder what was the logic behind 
that decision...)
Time to mix drinks and change lives.
What kind of work do you do, mister...?

(The day started with quite the 
interesting fellow, it seems.)

So you're the one to blame for the 
barrage of daily articles on Alice_Rabbit, 
then?

Well, I'm not complaining about the 
fact you write about the hacker. Just that 
you write about them every single day.

Some of it isn't even news. Just 
speculations or ...copycats.

I can't read your newspaper's daily 
feed without running into at least ONE 
article about Alice_Rabbit.

Well, I always filter out that section. 
I don't want to start my day scared and 
bitter.

I have enough pressure and problems 
as is. I don't need to add Glitch City's 
lovely citizens to the list.
(Huh, I guess he has a point...)

What about the opinion columns? Aren't 
those a good source of traffic too?

I think you're being too harsh. What 
about...?

...no, wait. I was thinking of another 
newspaper. Yeah, the columnists on your 
page are annoying.

I do remember some guy coming here 
asking for free drinks, and saying he was 
a critic or whatever.

Please stop referring to this place as 
a hell hole.

Not really. At least, not that I know 
of. Why?

Nah, I think gossip is just something 
everyone enjoys but nobody wants to admit 
to enjoying.

Sadly, I fail to see the appeal in that 
whole thing.

What do I care if this guy I saw in 
some random movie was wearing socks with 
sandals or if they're dating god-knows-who?

(Granted, socks with sandals is 
practically a public indecency, but 
still.)

E-even if that's the case, I don't 
sensationalize what people do.

I don't make it more than "That person 
you know from TV acts like a human".

Just the other day, I saw this 
"Committee" judge bitching over what some 
girl was wearing to the store.

No matter what you say, these people 
don't exist solely to entertain the public.

Can't say that's a lie, but... 
sometimes the crowd just wants to 
see they're human.

"Hey! That dude that plays the nice guy 
is indeed a really nice guy!"

To be fair, the gossip articles 
don't help. Sensationalizing everything.

It feels like they're instigating a 
behaviour that shouldn't even be 
acknowledged in the first place.

No, I'm a lab rat hellbent on world 
conquest.

It would be like that priest who 
published "Confessionary Stories"... and 
then got excommunicated and lynched.

People usually tell me all this stuff 
because they know I'm just a simple 
bartender...

Eventually, the people from the stories 
would know it's them and blame me.

Not only would that hurt us as a 
business, it would hurt me. I really like 
hearing clients rant about their lives.

Oh... and it would hurt the clients 
too, I guess.

(Yeah, like you'll remember me two 
weeks from now.)
Do you want another drink, Mr. Donovan?

Do you want your employees to get 
personal with you, Mr. Donovan?
(He didn't call it a hell hole?)

There was some bloke named Sven that 
wanted to give us money if we stamped his 
face all over the place.

These bars are pretty much like any 
fast food chain, so there are no local 
investors.

You still have to answer to unions, the 
government, and those kind of organizations, 
don't you?
At least he paid before storming off.

(I wonder what happened with Sven 
though. We never heard from him again.)
Mr. Donovan, can I ask you something?

No, it's not that... well, not exactly. 
How did you start in this business?

Oh yeah, I remember the news. It was 
quite a mess.

And what made you pick a news website 
as business?

Yeah, thank you very much. Please come 
again.

Crafty dogs, I tell you. You'd think 
their short legs would hinder them.

Shh... you'll wake up Briar Rose over 
there.
Welcome to Valhalla, what can I...
I just felt like you needed it.

I'm surprised you decided to come to 
our little "crackhouse" at all, mister...

Sorry for the question then, Mr. Ingram 
McDougal.

Sorry about the smell, we're working on 
fixing it. There was an... incident over the 
weekend.

Please... let me know what I can do to 
make your experience more pleasant 
regardless.

May I ask why you decided to come to 
our bar then?
A regular? Can I ask who?
Below the sink where it's always been.

So, any other feedback you want to 
provide the establishment so we can enhance 
your customer experience?

That's... an interesting change of 
heart.

That's... an achievement and a title 
I've never heard before.

I know Boss did quite a few things 
before opening this bar, but that sounds...

Would you happen to know how she got 
her mechanical arm?

You've had an interesting change of 
attitude.

You can relax, though. I've only seen 
her deal with clients personally about two 
or three times.

One involved Class-5 weaponry, the 
other one a "pick-up artist", and the 
latest had an alpaca.

There's this woman that owns a textile 
company.

She got really drunk and... she started 
screaming she was an alpaca.

She started spitting on everything 
afterwards. My boss had to show her the 
exit.

I'd rather not remember that night, so 
let's leave it at that.
Can I get you anything else?

(Please? There's a word I haven't heard 
today.)

It's a local drink. My coworker came 
up with it. He calls it a Suplex.

No, it's safe. It's even been added to 
the BTC's official recipe book.

You look stressed from seeing my boss. 
Sweet drinks can help with that.

(No retort? He seems a tad too 
submissive for me.)

Then is my serving you sweet drinks 
resurrecting bad memories?
I'm sorry, I think I heard wrong.
That's a question I'm not gonna answer.
...I say lies are like your porn stash.

You know they exist but you shouldn't 
acknowledge them.

Still, that's quite the random thought 
to just suddenly have.

Are you perhaps lying about something 
right now?

Already? Don't you think you're 
drinking a bit quickly?
Try not to drink it too fast.
Opinion? Can't say I have much of one.

I haven't had enough encounters with 
the White Knights to form one myself.

...don't take this the wrong way, but 
nothing's changed, really.

I haven't interacted with enough White 
Knights to form an opinion of my own.

If I started judging groups based on 
only a few examples, I'd be against all 
Lilim because one of them went rogue.
I guess I know how that feels.

Sometimes, something happens and I know 
I should feel mad or sad, but I can't muster 
it. And that worries me.

Emotions will rush in when you least 
expect it, and mourning doesn't necessarily 
involve lots of tears.
Have you tried taking up a hobby?

It might not solve your problems, but 
it might keep you busy enough to avoid 
thinking about it.

Well... collecting stuff, reading, 
bungee jumping, combat sports, exercising...

I'm drawing a blank then. Can't think 
of anything that might help.
Boss, I'm gonna take my break!

Um... would you mind taking your helmet 
off?
What can I get you, miss...?
What can I get for you, Sei?

A sweet drink. Preferably a cold one 
that's not too big. Right?
I can do that. Give me a sec.

We don't get many White Knights as 
clients. I can only remember one other, in 
fact.

You said you're from the Valkyrie 
corps, right? Are you the guys who deal 
with riots and such?

You mentioned 'heal'. Are you a doctor 
then?
Damn, that must be a tough job.
You must've seen some shocking sights.

T-That's not what I meant by "shocking 
sights".

Don't worry, you didn't mishear. I 
guess I was just expecting a different kind 
of answer.
Don't... worry too much about it.

You finished your drink - can I get 
you anything else?

No problem. Don't worry. A classy 
drink, right? Let's see what I can find 
for you.
Oh sure, just call me Jill.
Do. NOT. Call me Julianne, please.

It's a stupid reason. Don't dwell too 
much on that.

That... actually helps. You're the 
first person to say something nice today, 
thanks.
What do you like about it?

*ahem* What made you become a White 
Knight instead of a veterinarian or... 
anything else?

Huh... it's interesting though: one 
would think being attacked by a White Knight 
would make you run the opposite direction.
Yeah. I try to do the same too.

Why join the Valkyrie corps 
specifically, though?

Now that I think about it, there are 
different kinds of White Knights, right?
Can I get you anything else?
Gil, did the ammonia make you go nuts?!

It's Brandtini, trust me. I'll get 
you one.
Anyway, I better call a cab and-
...and now, I don't need to call a cab.

Oh... but it looks like I'll be 
holding her helmet until she realizes she 
left it here.

Don't worry, I know the kind of place 
I work in.

(Well, if she's coming back, I'll just 
hold it for her.)
Good evening and welcome to Valhalla.

(That might not have been the best 
thing to say.)
As far as I can tell? No.

To be fair, I don't know how death or 
the afterlife work exactly, but you're 
breathing, right?

I'm waiting for you to vent your 
worries. Otherwise you'll just...

(Well, this is going nowhere, let's 
see if I can get a drink to calm her down... 
or to throw at her face.)

A drink. You're in a bar. Bars serve 
drinks.

So I figured I should give you 
something to help you calm down. Don't 
worry, it's on the house.

G-God no... I wouldn't even think of 
it.

If I ever added anything like that to 
your drink, they'd dock my pay and tips.

Not to mention I'd have to pay any 
lawsuits myself.

And that's the best case scenario. I 
could get fired and lose benefits or go to 
jail.

And trust me, the BTC LOVES to catch 
anyone who commits that particular felony.

They'd show themselves all proud for 
a hefty PR boost.

And the thought of going through all 
that is just...

If you go outside, and head just three 
businesses to the left, you'll find a 
convenience store.

They sell drug tests for drinks. Tell 
the cashier that Dana Zane sent you.

Did you check inside the toilet paper's 
locker?
No problem then. Try it on the drink.

Good point, but first of all: It's not 
my name. It's my boss'.

Second, we are pretty much part of a 
chain. Sorta like the Spicy Chicken of 
bars.

And finally, I'm not making you drink 
this. I offered it to you as a sign of 
peace.

I mean, you ARE right. It IS indeed 
suspicious on my part. Sorry.

You can just ignore the drink, go 
through that door, and forget this ever 
happened.

That would be it. You're at peace and 
nothing of value would be lost.

Um... not sure you should drink it all 
so fast.

No problem. If I were you, I'd have 
probably reacted the same way.

I should apologize for my last comment 
too, it came out as insensitive.

My boss found you unconscious and 
brought you here for safekeeping.

Aaaaand you were asleep until that car 
crash outside.

How did you fall unconscious? Were you 
tired? Sick?

...I'll tell you what. Your drinks are 
on the house tonight.

Consider it an apology on behalf of 
everyone here for all the trouble we've 
caused you.

Also, something tells me you might need 
another drink right now.

What did he do? Your dad, I mean. To 
provoke the pianist like that.

The Piano Man has an interesting 
story.

It was originally created by a 
bartender in honor of a pianist friend 
of his that had just died.

Apparently, it mixes all the flavors 
said friend liked the most.
(Who? And what the hell is a "sama"?)

I read it every morning. In fact, 
Donovan D. Dawson was here earlier.
Why are you working there, then?
Did I ask something I shouldn't have?

I guess it's as hard as being a cook 
somewhere.

You keep going through the motions 
while trying to provide something of 
quality.

All while answering the whimsy of 
people's orders.

I think the hardest part is dealing 
with the chemical hazards some people might 
leave behind. Why?

Well, it depends on where you start 
working, you know?

I guess I was lucky Valhalla didn't 
end up being a tacky disco overseen by a 
DJ with an afro.

My boss just wanted a comfy place, I 
think.

She is! She's so cool and collected, 
but has no qualms about showing excitement 
about stuff.

Sure, she's been a bit tense the last 
couple of days...

But even then, when you're with her 
everything just feels under control.

She also has this mechanical arm. I 
have no idea how she got it, but...

Shall I call her? She'd be glad to 
know you're okay.

You can ask for another one, although 
I don't know how much alcohol you can 
handle.

I work FOR a woman, but my only 
co-worker is male, why?

Have you tried making friends with any 
of them?

No sleeping here, please. Do you want 
me to call you a cab?
Hey, it's Jill, can you send us a cab?
Hey Kim, I'm gonna need your full name.

Kimberly La Vallette... no, I have no 
idea how to spell it... no, she's too sleepy 
to answer that.

(She's been through a lot today, I 
guess.)

Guide Miss La Vallette to her cab on 
your way out, please.
Not really. It just kinda happened.

One thing led to another and BAM, 
bartending.

The only dream I can remember being 
passionate about was buying a Model 
Warrior Julianne arcade machine.

Can't say I've given up on that one 
yet. But alas, adult stuff needs to be paid 
for first.

Not really. I mean, most of my 
dreams have been silly things or 
childish dreams.

Having a room where every piece of 
furniture talks, being a Model Warrior...

None that I felt particularly motivated 
to chase, no.

I mean, I'm fascinated by AIs, but I 
just couldn't find it in me to study that.

So, I picked something I found nice and 
moved on.

And somewhere along the way, I became a 
bartender.

A ghost. Nobody you should worry 
about.

Why were you asking all those 
questions?

I think we idealize the idea of a 
dream job too much.

Not everyone walks around with a clear 
idea of what they want in life.

Some take a liking to a job, others 
find it after many failed attempts.

Sometimes life takes an unexpected turn 
that makes you change your plans...

...what I mean is: Don't worry too 
much about it.

Gil cleaned the bathroom and left 
because he stank.

Kim woke up, had a couple of drinks, 
and left.

She was freaked out when she woke up, 
but she managed to calm down.

Hey Boss, do you feel like calling you 
"Boss" is too impersonal?

At least I didn't get locked up this 
time.

I threw away everything I had in my 
life to be here.

People I loved were pushed aside 
just so I could enjoy my freedom of being 
here.

So I will come here until I die, 
even after the bar closes, until my hair 
falls out.
Yeah? Well... your hair is... hairy!

Agh! Who was the dipshit that 
changed the order of the glasses?!

Oh yeah, I was too busy staring at 
my crumbling life and all that.

My girlfrie-... my ex-girlfriend 
died and I wasn't there to see her one 
last time.

All because of a fight I spent all 
these years regretting and wishing to, but 
never actually apologizing for.

My decision to assert my freedom and 
grab a hold of my life led me to this.

A bartender strapped for cash that 
distanced herself from her loved ones for 
no other reason than selfishness.

So I won't fucking leave. I threw 
all of that away to be here, so here I 
will stay!

This is what I wanted, this is why I 
left all of that behind, this is why...

I feel like a shit-eating piece of 
shit.

I'm the lowest of any possible life 
form you might find.

Nanobes look down to me in disgust, 
knowing they're far superior.

What part of "I won't leave" didn't 
you understand?!

I didn't leave everyone behind to 
just sit and do nothing!

I'm waiting for you to order like a 
decent human being.

Spell out your order like you're a 
human who is not in need of medical help.

No, I'm just filled with ridiculous 
amounts of anger, pain, and self-hate, 
and...

...on second thought, you're not 
that far from the truth, I guess.

And here I was, thinking you'd get 
to say something serious for once.

...I'll be damned. That actually 
sounded half-sensible.

And here I was thinking you were 
just a pompous lunatic.

(Maybe he's right and I shouldn't be 
so hard on myself.)

(Even though I deserve every second 
of it.)

(If only I had apologized earlier, I 
might not be feeling this way right now.)

(I... I can't even remember what 
held me from apologizing all these years.)

(Pride? Fear? What kept me from 
going out and apologizing to Lenore?)

(I can't even fucking remember what 
feeling kept me from fixing this whole 
situation?!)

(Can't I at least find solace in 
whatever feeling it was that brought me to 
this situation?!)

(Great, now I'm feeling even worse 
thanks to not being able to muster 
whatever feeling held me.)
Oh, thank god. A normal person.

You look better, though. Last time 
you came, you looked like you were about to 
collapse emotionally.

Yeah, don't mind me too much. I'm in 
a bad mood.

Please forgive me if I suddenly lash 
out. At you or anyone else.
I'm fine, nothing's happened to me.
No, I'm not on my period.

*sigh* I'm dealing with the loss of 
someone, okay?

*sigh* Maybe I shouldn't have come 
today after all.

I was exactly like that when Stella 
came here on Monday talking about you.

You were just sitting with a 
Valkyrie.

*sigh* I'd feel bad about the way I 
treated him today.

...if not for the fact that he was 
being cryptic with his orders for no good 
reason.

Yeah. I just keep messing things up 
with people.

That reminds me. How did Stella 
react when you arrived?

Just pretend I'm in a bad mood and 
call it a day.

*sigh* Someone to whom I said some 
mean thing to passed away before I could 
ever see her again.
You could always order another drink.

Do you sing? I mean... did you take 
singing lessons or something?

I used to play the violin. Right 
until I was... 16 or so.

The violin's at my mom's house, so I 
don't have it with me.

But I guess I could. It's one of 
those things you don't forget easily.

I don't know. One day, I just felt 
like stopping. No deep reason behind it.

You do that, I'm going to take my 
break. Tell Gil if you need anything else.

I still feel like kicking myself, 
make no mistake.
...but I guess I cooled down a bit.

Sei helped a lot with that one, 
though. I just can't stay mad when I 
see her.
Speaking of which, where is she?

So I'm assuming that gorilla outside 
is a bodyguard?
Can I ask you two something?

So you two have known each other for 
most of your lives?

No reason. You two just look so 
comfortable with each other. Any other 
person could've sworn you were an item.

So you two didn't go to the same 
high school?

Childhood friends... can't think of 
any. My grandpa, I guess.

Gruff. The kind to eat raw Bronson 
roots every morning.
But around me he, was... different.

I have memories of him barking 
orders to my dad, only to turn around and 
play with me gently.

It's interesting though. He was my 
mom's dad. But after my mom and dad 
separated, he stayed with my dad.

But yeah, he's the one that comes to 
mind when I think about childhood friends.

A spicy drink. Tastes nice the first 
time but it gets same-y after a while. 
It's also brown for some reason.
Well, good karma and all that.

Sometimes the best help one can 
provide is to stay alive.

Who knows? Maybe it was the idea of 
coming back to you that helped her.

And I guess you wouldn't be human 
without thoughts like those once in a 
while.
Can I get you anything else?
I guess you helped me cool off a bit.

Take care of Sei. Don't lose someone 
like her over something stupid.

*sigh* Let's just say I said some 
mean things to someone and now I can't 
make amends for it.

"Learn from your mistakes"... I 
guess that's all that's left.
No, I just don't reek of rage.

But I still feel like a piece of 
shit.
So, how's work on the webpaper?

Um... Sorry again about that by the 
way.

Don't you have any second thoughts? 
Regret anything?
It'll also kill things inside you.

I gotta ask though. How did you end 
up working there?
It's a really common tale, I guess.

Same story as you. I just... went 
through the motions.

From high school to college, I never 
stopped to think about what I was doing.

And then, at some point, I just felt 
like my life slipped through my fingers.

Suddenly all I wanted was freedom, a 
little pause. To stop and take a breather.

...and my life went to hell for that 
fucking breather.

Don't fret about it. I'm just in 
a... rough spot right now.
What are you gonna do now?
Well, I wish you the best of luck.

Your mental health should be your 
priority and all that.

Come back if you need more 
encouragement.

I wouldn't dare leave someone alone 
when it comes to this sort of thing.

Ah, Dorothy. Sorry, we're just 
closing.

What do you hope to accomplish with 
that?

That's some alien reasoning right 
there.

(Stella and Sei make me a bit 
jealous...)

I still hate myself, I'm still sad 
as hell, but... how to put it... the noise 
stopped.
I don't know if I explained myself.

I can't believe you paid Dorothy for 
that.
Anyways, we have work to do.
Time to mix drinks and change lives.

Welcome to Valha-... oh, it's you 
guys.

Aren't you a part-timer here or 
something?
So, what brings you here today?

Wait, aren't you the dog I served 
last Monday?

So I'm guessing you're part of this 
whole CIRA thing.
And do you take Corgis only?

(Sad thing is, I'd take him more 
seriously... but it's a talking Corgi with 
an eyepatch.)

(I mean, we're pretty much on the 
verge of closing. Can Boss really 
afford that?)

(Wait... don't tell me she just 
doesn't give a fuck and is spending all of 
her money like water.)

(I mean, what with the bar closing 
and all that.)

(Unless she's paying him straight 
from her pocket. Boss is that kind of 
woman.)

(Wait... that theory only works 
assuming she's actually paying him with 
money.)

(For all I know, she might be paying 
him with steaks.)

(...except that to Boss, a good 
steak is more valuable than money.)

(Besides, Boss is not one to scam 
people, let alone a dog...)
(Oh yeah, forgot she knew the dog.)
No, that's not the problem here.
When you put it that way...

...shit, I missed the chance to ask 
how, or if he even gets paid with money.

I've been through some stuff lately, 
but I'm getting better. Don't worry.

Lots of people have noticed that I'm 
not all that okay. Is it that obvious?

The amount of Beer cans in my 
apartment is becoming a problem, actually.

No, thanks. The last thing I need 
right now is more crap taking space.
So, how are things up at dog town?

Say, this Laura girl. Do you guys 
get along?

What kind of girl is she? Aside from 
the whole politically-correct rabbit... 
thing.

If that Laura girl is really as... 
bland as you claim her to be, wouldn't she 
be better off with a more... um...
A more assertive person... Lilim... uh...

Seems it was first developed at some 
video games event.

The creator said something about 
making the attendees feel like their 
customers do.

Said attendees were, of course, 
part of some big games company.

Seems that company always used too much 
bloom lighting, so the bartender there 
literally made them drink all the bloom.
In more ways than one, I guess.

I guess for the better. I'm too 
thick-headed to develop any new bad 
habits.

Although thanks to my first boyfriend, 
I did pick up a very annoying habit of 
correcting people's grammar on the fly.

Pretty annoying when I think back to 
it.

So it wasn't so much the person you 
had a relationship with, but rather other 
people.

Well, I had to sleep here. The 
streets were too messy.

Thank god my boss escorted to my 
place on Sunday.

Oh yeah... I guess they're dogs 
after all.

Wait, they spent the whole time 
there?

You'd think with the world pretty 
much connected, everyone would realize 
stuff like that.

Having revealed the White Knights as 
the "bad guys" with the help of 
irrefutable evidence..

Anyone who gets involved against 
them gets a free PR boost.

I heard a neighboring city had a

me a drink?
I want...
To leave! Bye, Bartender!

Stella.text: Excuse me...

Oh god! I can't believe I'm actually 
here! The concert will begin any second 
now!
KYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!

KYAAAAAAAH!! SHE'S COMING OUT! IT'S 
HER! IT'S ACTUALLY HER!

The way you are right now, it 
feels like I should be protecting you.

Yeah, I remember that one. 1mm 
more and you would've lost the motor 
function in your arm.
Ah. Hello, Jill.

My father insists I go everywhere 
with protection. So most of the time I 
only ask Sei if she feels like going out.

She's trained to deal with the 
kind of things that bodyguards deal with 
anyway.

And she's more fun to hang around 
with too.

We've offered him an implant 
surgery for all his years of service, but 
he rejects it every time.

It's a thick oak branch on a metal 
bowl tied to his stump.
True.

A Brandtini. A big one. I'm in a 
good mood.

After all these years, I still 
don't get why the finest and most 
expensive things come in small packages.

Ever tried to go to a restaurant 
only for them to serve you a really small 
portion of some fine food?

Sometimes you just want to... 
stuff yourself with really cheap food.

Sei, let's go for some hamburgers 
later. I'm not taking a no for an answer.

I guess this means my good mood 
is halved now.
Aaaaand the good mood's gone.
I guess.

*ahem* My father told me that, 
when I was 5, I kept insisting on going to 
a "real kid's park."

We drove for some time, and the 
park I liked was the one Sei happened to 
be at.
...a couple, Sei.
...Three years in a row.
What kind of man was he?
*brrrrrr*
I'll have one too.

Yeah, but after the third one, it 
starts tasting like sand.
Spicy sand, but sand nonetheless.
Here you go. You have this one.

This other one. Bloom Lights taste 
like sand to me.

First time I'm glad someone messed 
up my order.

Huh... I guess she had too much 
before I came.

Well, that, and that she must 
still be tired.

She told me about everything that 
happened in there. To be honest, I don't 
think I would've made it in her place.

I guess I should be thankful for 
the nanomachine treatment she went through 
as a White Knight.
Trauma suppressors.

Basically, it helps with the 
healing process of PTSD.

It's mandatory for every White 
Knight, regardless of division.
Still, healing can only do so much.

For three days, that bank was 
hell. And poor Sei is still paying for it.

The disbanding of the White Knights 
and subsequent persecution of those who 
were identifed as former members...

It's unfair, you know? Among all 
the people using the White Knights to 
further their own goals...

Sei was one of the few that 
actually believed in what they were 
supposed to do.
It paid off though.

The doctor who treated her wounds 
was the same one she's always assisted 
with accidents and emergencies.

He treated her at no cost 
whatsoever.

She's earned the gods' favor, I 
think.

...but you know. All of that made 
me realize I might be a bad person.

When I saw Sei, wounded, asking 
for help; a part of me was happy.

After all this time needing her, 
she finally needed ME.

I felt truly useful to her for the 
first time.
*sigh* How sad is that?
Maybe.

I'm good. I should be leaving 
actually.

Come, Sei. Let's get hamburgers and 
go home.
Sei, come on. We need to go.
We'll be leaving now.
My father.

Well, what did you expect? If he 
behaved like that during business 
meetings, they'd eat him alive.
"Socialite".

My dadd-... er... father, told me 
since I was very young to "cultivate a 
shallow, dim-witted, daddy's girl persona".

"They will lower their guard 
thinking you're just another rich daddy's 
girl. That's when we strike!" He said.
S-Shut up!

Yeah. Disappointed her name isn't 
star-themed?

Your mom isn't too far behind 
though. Being a veterinarian requires 
quite the thick skin.
You sure you can handle that?
I'll have a Beer too, then.
*sigh* You take the Beer, Sei.
You wanted one, right?
I guess that's it for today.
Good night.
And that's the cue for us to leave.

Buster! Please carry Sei to the 
car.
Yes?

...sure, I wasn't planning to 
anyways.
Goodnight, Jill.

Jiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiill, you smell 
gloomy!

You usually just LOOK gloomy... 
but today, your face is making me feel down!
What happened to you?!

I'll leave after she tells me 
what happened!
IIIIIIIIIIdiot. You're an idiot!

If you said mean things and you're 
sorry, just say you're sorry!

A friendship isn't worth a bit of 
pride!
Now we're leaving.
Learn from your mistakes, Jill!
Seeeeeeeeeeei! Wake uuuuuuuuuuuuup!
Bars aren't a place to sleep!
Buster! Get Sei in the car!
We're out Jill.
Haaaappy holidays!

We held a party for the staff and 
their children...

You should've seen the faces of 
those kids receiving gifts.

Nabbing that Santa suit at the 
last minute the other day was totally 
worth it.

There was this... weird shortage 
of Santa suits, but luck was on my side 
this year!
*ahem* Sorry for that... outburst.
Um...

A-Anyway, can you get me a Cobalt 
Velvet, please?
Thanks.

I-I'll forgive you this time. I'm 
in a good mood.
She should be here in a bit.

She told me she wanted a drink 
here and since I was coming here too...

Sadly, I can't stay for long. I 
have some errands to run.

She's better. Her wounds have been 
healing really nicely.

If only she stopped scratching at 
her bandages so often.
EYE?!
Oh, hers. Sorry...

*ahem* It'll take longer to heal, 
but as long as it's kept clean, there 
should be no problem.

But to be honest, I'm more worried 
about her emotional wounds.

She doesn't show it, but she's had 
depressive bouts from time to time.

And who can blame her? Her life 
changed completely.

The job she loved no longer 
exists, she was used as a disposable pawn 
in the whole bank affair...

I'm afraid it will all make her go 
back to her old ways.

There was a... rough spot when Sei 
was a teen.

Her mom's clinic was about to 
close. Then, her biological father, who 
was an asshole, showed up.

And the teachers at her school 
didn't help.

Sei is not a slow learner by any 
means, but her way of learning stuff is... 
different.

She needs equivalences to things 
she knows. You need to get a bit in her 
mindset.

Once you get this, she's a fast 
learner... but schools don't have that 
kind of patience.

They basically branded her a 
failure. She even dropped out.

I would've suggested a special 
course somewhere else, but that would've 
offended her.

She's always been against being 
labeled as "special" or "different".

Anyway, Sei was totally different 
during that period.
Foul-mouthed, short-fused...

Always frowning; the total 
opposite of how she is nowadays.

From time to time, I see that old 
look cross her face and it scares me.
I hope so.

Get me something cold and sweet, 
will you?
Thanks.
Now that you mention it...
Hm... not cold enough.
This... isn't sweet, Jill.
Oh yeah. She told me that.

Glad she found a familiar face 
after all that chaos.
You did?

I guess I should be thanking you 
then.

When I met with her, she told me 
you calmed her down quite a bit.

I'm guessing with all that was 
going on, the desire to not worry me 
weighed on her. It has happened before.

So it's good there was someone 
else for her to share her stress with.
Thanks.

It's a mess they've tried to fix 
over time, and I'm glad to say they've 
actually done it.

Sei's mom had a... really abusive 
relationship with Sei's biological father.

Sadly, like many women in that 
situation, she just tried to justify his 
actions.

But, apparently, things got nasty 
when Sei's mom, Miss Emi, got pregnant.

At that point she had... an 
epiphany, one could say.

She didn't want that guy to raise 
her child. So she finally sought help.
Things weren't so easy though.

Before the authorities could take 
him away, Miss Emi got a serious beating 
from him.

She still uses a cane to walk, 
thanks to that.

She moved here, Sei was born. She 
started her veterinary clinic...

He was drunk and couldn't find any 
drugs, so he made it to the city.

He caused a ruckus for a couple of 
days until Sei managed to scare him off.

She beat him to near death... 
three times.
Oh, don't worry. I laughed too.

The dramatic irony there is 
delicious.
Hm?

Well, I have my security staff 
with me at all times, so there's no 
problem.

Besides, this part of the city 
is... comfier.

Sure, uptown is cleaner and maybe 
more secure, but it's also too... sterile.

Around here you can actually feel 
the warmth of the people. You feel 
there're people living.

I especially like going to a busy 
food stand - I feel a warmth there that 
uptown doesn't have.
You finally came.
Make that two.

I'm asking for one for me, adding 
one to your order.
Thank you.
Hm... you have the Beer.
Of course.
Um...

Seeeeeeeeeeei, you should've seen 
the kids after you left!

They were all playing with the 
toys you picked! You nailed it again 
this year.

They were all asking "Where's Sei? 
Where's Sei?"

Why do they call you just Sei when 
they call me "Auntie Stella?"
I don't look that old.
What happened?
Well, IIIIIIII'm out.

Sure, it's better than depressing 
myself with my dad's woes about the next 
fiscal year.
I'll be here.
Bye Jill. Bye Sei.
I think they're treating it well.

Cracking through it hasn't been 
easy though.
The armor is... um... locked.

As a countermeasure against the 
rogue agents that caused havoc the other 
day, Zaibatsu Corp deactivated them.

It was a remote safeguard nobody 
knew about, apparently.

All systems were shut down, and 
they couldn't be started manually.
Yup.

Many of the trouble-makers got 
caught because the system wouldn't even 
let them move.

Besides, if we can 
reverse-engineer the whole suit, we 
might...
Hm...

Sure. That'd be a nice change of 
pace.
Well, I gotta go.
Greetings.
I'll go with a Bleeding Jane today.
Thank you.
...right.

I came by myself, actually. I was 
in the area and stopped to say hi.

Well, this place is... 
comfortable, I must admit.
So quiet and secluded.
It's also clean, really clean.
Really?
I see.

Hey Jill, have you heard of the new 
gold rush in the city?

Everyone is paying small fortunes to 
get their hands on pieces of White Knight 
suits.

Well, the tech behind the suits was 
always safely guarded, but after the events 
at the bank...
...sorry.

After the events at the bank, the 
suits were remotely shut down, bricking 
many of them in the process.

Many units dropped their armor 
right there and fled when the lynchings 
went on.

Any White Knight still stuck in 
their suit had to take the armor off 
manually to run away.

It all happened in the middle of 
the lynchings, so they'd be sitting ducks 
if they didn't.

Some weren't that lucky. They got 
beaten up while they weren't able to move.

So, between the suits becoming 
glorified paperweights, and many White 
Knights going on the run...

There ended up being a lot of 
junk lying around.

But the whole scientific community is 
rejoicing.

They're on a race to reverse-engineer 
the suits and take as much technology as 
possible from them.

And of course, even single pieces of 
the armor fetch a high price these days.

It's new tech, a whole new field ripe 
with patents just opened for many. So I'd 
say yes.
There is one weird case though...

There's this guy named Jack. He's the 
captain of a very unique Blitzkrieg Corps 
unit.

The guy had a really small unit. Five 
people, including himself.

The aesthetics of his unit's armor 
was heavily modded to the point that they 
looked like a squad of Henshin Heroes.
*ahem* They looked really gaudy.

But it turned out that the guy 
actually broke through the software and 
disabled the remote switch.

He has one of the few - if not the 
only - suits of armor with the OS intact.

To say they're among the most wanted 
people would be an understandment.

It's interesting, the amount of things 
you hear when dealing with drunk people of 
all kinds in the same place.

It also helps to put on a front 
that makes people lower their guard...
That should sound familiar to you.
Here's a freebie. A fun fact.

The failsafe was originally going to 
involve the armor blowing up and leaving 
no traces.

But regulations and laws didn't allow 
that kind of technology near civilians.

People love to demonize Zaibatsu 
Corp. because, let's face it, they're far 
from innocent.

But they're not evil overlords, 
they're just... greedy. They're just a big 
corporation.

They just so happen to have control 
over what tantamounts to a city-state.

But corporations will naturally 
resort to draconian methods.

I've heard horror stories from people 
outside the city about trying to use product 
placement.

If you so much as hold a bottle the 
wrong way or get in the way of a logo, 
you'll be in for lots of trouble.

And let's not start with theme parks 
or the like. Those are dystopias of their 
own.
He has no power anyways.

He's just the front that whatever 
council behind Zaibatsu Corp. chose.

He makes a fool of himself and the 
attention is taken away from whatever it is 
that Zaibatsu Corp is actually doing.

I've called the White Knights 
"Glorified Mall Security" in the past, 
so yeah.
*ahem*
C-Can I get a Brandtini here, please?
Thanks.
Does it show?
Yeah, well...

I managed to nab a couple of 
tickets for the *Kira* Miki encore concert.
AGAIN?!
*ahem* Sorry.
Again?
Can't believe I just missed her.

Man, so those rumors about her 
being really nice in person were actually 
true? Amazing.
She WHAT?!

I had to twist some arms to get 
tickets for the encore concert...

And not only did you get them 
free, the idol herself gave them to you?!

Do you have any idea how jealous I 
am right now?

You're gonna enjoy the hell out of 
it. Trust me.

This will be my first live concert 
of her, but I've seen every other concert 
of hers on video.

They all have such a magical aura 
to them.

Everyone says they have to be seen 
to be believed.
It makes me happy. What can I say?

I love listening to it when I'm 
feeling down.

Hell, it even helped me when I was 
worried sick about Sei at the bank.

It made me forget all my worries, 
even if for a while.

Say, Jill, you wanna come to the 
concert with us?

I invited Sei because I managed to 
get two tickets. You wanna come with us 
both?
Of course! The more the merrier!

I mean, you always want the famous 
people to be nice in real life...

But having such backing to that 
claim, to hear that she's so nice to 
everyone...
It's nice to hear, you know?

In fact, many think that's what 
made her so famous so quickly.

How she's down to earth and 
totally accessible, making her someone 
everyone wants to root for.

Being a nice person will take you 
far, though.

My daddy always insisted that 
"being ruthless in the boardroom doesn't 
mean being an ass".

And he has actually managed to get 
certain contracts over other more powerful 
people.

All thanks to being a nice guy 
overall.
...*ahem*

You're not the kind to lie about 
stuff like that, so sure.

My dad always has a unit keeping 
an eye on me from a distance.

And you'd be surprised at how 
easily I can disguise myself with just a 
different hairdo and a cap.

I wonder if I could get in the 
disabled line with Sei and her wounds...

Although she'll probably nag me 
about how she doesn't need it and we 
shouldn't abuse that.

Hey, can you get me a classic 
drink?
Thank you.
This is classic how?
Eh, whatever.
About what?
That? Oh yeah, I knew.

Sei told me. I'm alright. Don't 
worry.

We all have our own share of 
painful stories. I might be just as 
shocked hearing something from you.

I've gotten over it, but every 
time someone brings attention to my eye, 
it... starts hurting.

The tech in the replacement is 
good enough, but remembering it hurts a 
bit.

Still, she also told you about 
that... Virgilio guy, didn't she?

Virgilio Armandio didn't net any 
results but after digging deeper, we found 
another name.

Timothy Mercury. Branded traitor 
after killing a fellow White Knight. 
Declared MIA.

Seems like the guy knew how to 
hide himself.

At the very least, seek him to 
thank him. It's the least I can do.

I do, but they've been with us for 
so long, they're pretty much family.

My dad has always said that if you 
earn someone's trust, they'll gleefully 
work for you, and everyone wins.

We even had a young gardener that 
left to study engineering. And he actually 
came back!

He still comes by every weekend to 
tend the plants.

Let me know if you're ever in need 
of a job, I might find you something.
Hm?
What would it be?

That would be true if the tech was 
patented in the first place.

Zaibatsu have been so paranoid about 
making the White Knights untouchable that 
they never patented anything.

A patent would be in a database 
that someone could hack and retrieve 
valuable info from.

Not to mention they've been using 
tech from other companies without any 
authorization.

And no patent registry in their 
right mind would approve of that global 
shutdown signal.

Let alone how it immobilized 
everyone still inside one of those suits.

The irony runs deep, wouldn't you 
say?

When you have so much money, you 
start thinking you can screw around with 
the rules.

All that power makes you think 
you're above every law there is.

...I think we've all done things 
we're not too proud of at some point of 
our lives.

Well, Jill. I gotta go. Always a 
pleasure.
This place looks familiar...

Excuse me, is this the... VA-11 Hall-A 
bar?
...oh god, what is Sei planning now?

I want a drink whose name was changed 
after many women protested. Can you get 
me that?
Very nice. Thanks a lot.

*sigh* You just gave up mid way through, 
didn't you?
I'm Stella Hoshii. My pleasure.
My name's in the payment registry.

Yeah. I know her. She's been here 
before, yes?

...oh, god. So she left her helmet 
behind, again.

Her helmets have been picked up by 
all sorts of people in the last three 
months.

Valets, nurses, morticians, fire 
jugglers...

She's been lucky enough to always 
leave it with people who return it, at 
least.

Sei's as much of a sociable girl as 
she is a total klutz.

At least when she's not being 
serious. She's very competent when she 
puts her mind to it.
We're meeting here today.

I can see why she chose this place. 
It's the kind of place she likes.
I'm just waiting for her here.
Hm...

Say, is that *Kira* Miki's autograph 
on that glass?
How did you get it?
REALLY?!
...I mean...
She did?
Can I see it?

Yup, this star-like signature is 
hers.
So your name's Jill then?
Ain't this nice?
Here you go.
Just call me Stella.
I do.

Whenever you hear her songs, you're 
filled with so much energy and happiness.

I heard she even opened with a new 
version of Shine Spark!

I'm so vexed that I couldn't 
purchase a ticket for this one.

Yes, I heard a leak from the event. 
It felt more... how to put it... hot 
blooded.

Too bad I couldn't purchase tickets 
for this one.

I mean, they were sold out in 
minutes!

Luckily I could secure a couple for 
the next time she comes around.

And I've only listened to a couple 
of her songs. Honestly.

T-They're catchy, I guess. But 
that's it.
Oh, excuse me for a second.
Hello? Where the hell are you?!
Car crash?! Oh, you're helping.
Will it take long? Alright.
Yeah, yeah. Don't worry.
Yes.
I will.

In the meantime, I feel like 
having another drink.

One that was prepared in memory of 
its creator's dearest friend.
Yes, exactly.
Thank you.

Maybe I'm being too cryptic, but 
you should know these ones already...
It isn't about my eye, is it?

Before I was born, I was diagnosed 
with Nanomachine Rejection.

So, it had to be done. Otherwise, I 
would've died shortly after birth.

I'm a bit on the weak side because 
of it, though.
I don't mind.

It's always nice to dispel the idea 
that my parents were just into the fad.
I'd rather not talk about it.
It's fine.
You seem to know your drinks, Jill.
Do you like alcohol?
Not at all.

Do you collect them or anything like 
that?
I'm here, right?

But I'm normally more of a social 
drinker.

Unless it's with somebody, I don't 
tend to drink much.

Your co-worker has been acting 
strange for a while now.

Yeah, yeah. Stare at the cat-eared 
girl when allergies enter the fray. How 
classy.

S-So, Gil and Jill. isn't that 
confusing?
You took your sweet time.

I would suggest using ground 
transportation, but I'm happy to see 
you put safety first.

I still don't understand how they 
don't give you motion sickness.
I'd like a drink that was...

Hey, I expect only the best from 
whoever serves me.

They need to be able to answer 
these kind of orders.

She's done quite well so far, 
actually.
...maybe.
That'll be two Fringe Weavers, then.
No, we're sharing.
Don't worry, you'll see.

This one's for you and this one's 
for me. You said you wanted whatever I asked 
for, right?
Mm hmm.
T-Thanks...
You stupid, stupid, stupid woman.

How do you lose your helmet so 
easily?!

What if something falls on your 
head?! You'd be left even more stupid 
than you are now, you stupid!

It's not okay! It's never okay! 
What would I do without you?!

If something happens to you, how 
could I... *sniff*
M-Maybe...
Yeah...
I know, but...
You promise to come back?
Yay~
Sei... I'm tired...
Aight.

You really need to be more careful 
with your things.

Those spares should be saved for when 
the one you're using breaks or malfunctions, 
not when you lose it.
Those helmets cost money, you know?

Speaking of money, you still going 
to that meeting at the bank tomorrow?
I'd be lying if I said I wasn't.
...yeah.
You're quite strong, but...
Maybe...
...alright.

Seems my vehicle is here to pick me 
up. You coming, Sei?
Okay then. Take care.
*mumble* Yeah...
Hello, Jill.

Not really. I was just around the 
neighborhood, and...

A-Anyway, I found this bottle being 
neglected at my house.

And thought someone who likes old 
liquor as much as you would appreciate it.
Well, it's nothing, really...
Oh, gods... SEI!
Um... Jill, was it?

Yeah... um... just call me Stella. 
And get me a big Beer, please.
You know Sei, right?

She was at the Apollo Trust Bank 
during that whole affair and...

She didn't show up on the list of 
the massive body count in the aftermath, 
so...

I was hoping that maybe you've seen 
her.
Yeah, I figured as much.
EYE?!
...sorry, I'm a bit on edge.
A private detective, I take it?
What's his name?

Oh, that Art guy. Yeah, I actually 
hired him yesterday to look for Sei.

I'm somewhere between Bargaining and 
Depression right now. And I'm afraid to let 
go of Bargaining.

He doesn't look like it, but he's 
quite skilled at gathering intel.

I believe he'll give me answers 
about Sei... whatever they might be.
Sorry if I'm making you uncomfortable.

I'm glad to know you have that much 
common sense, at least.

Something sweet. That'll help me calm 
down a bit.
Thanks.

I don't have brothers or sisters, 
and my social interactions are usually 
strictly business.

So Sei's more than a friend to me, 
she's... she's...
*ahem* Don't worry about it.

As I was saying, she's more than a 
friend. She's my emotional support, she's 
someone I can trust wholeheartedly.

I'd say she's like my sister, but 
siblings usually lack that level of trust.

I have to deal with high-class pricks 
of every race and upbringing on a daily 
basis.

They use a "business mask" to hide 
anything they don't want others to know and 
I do the same.

But with Sei I can be myself, I can 
do whatever I want and vent all my 
frustrations.

She's always been there for me, and 
now she might need me...

But here I am, sitting in a bar, 
making other people do that job because 
I'm a useless pile of flesh!
...sorry about the outburst.
I'm fine, thanks.

I'm just giving you the facts as 
they are.

While I won't deny Zaibatsu Corp is 
anything but innocent...

When you get down to it, it has 
enhanced the quality of life here.

True, I don't know. And true, I have 
a privilege that clouds my judgement.

But can you deny that the meddling of 
Zaibatsu Corp has brought quite a few 
benefits?

The AI Integration Program they 
started is making huge advances in the AI 
department.

Every day, more and more countries 
are seeing the benefits of recognizing AIs 
as citizens.

Fair point. Although that program HAS 
proven to have reformed many AIs.

They don't brag about their 88% 
success rate for nothing.
The city also has a stronger economy.

Zaibatsu Corp's success has made more 
and more companies bring their products 
here.

But it also means more products are 
being brought to the lower classes.

Stores have 20% more brand variety 
compared to last year.

Zaibatsu Corp's main Medical 
Research branch has also made lots of 
discoveries.

More and more illnesses, previously 
thought incurable, are being addressed every 
day.
You have a point there.

Oh, but there are also more jobs. 
All of the companies coming down here 
need personnel.

So the unemployment rate has gone 
down by almost 40% this year.
Am I wrong?
It's your order, though.
Because it's not the right order.

Of course I do, why else would I say 
it?

You do bring up something I always 
fail to remember. All the benefits we've 
gained over time are limited to a few.

I can talk about advances all I want, 
but in the end, they're still a luxury 
belonging only to a few.

And even those that can be accessed 
by everyone are more like an improvement in 
the bigger picture.

That doesn't take away the fact 
that there have been positive changes.

Credit where credit's due, don't you 
think?

Discussions are a way for two parties 
to understand each other.

The only people afraid of discussion 
are the ones whose points are too fragile 
to defend against someone.

I'm gonna take the chance to ask you 
about that job I gave you yesterday.
What does that mean?
...I see.

No, he just so happened to come here 
today.
I see. Thanks, keep it up.

Hope is the last thing you lose, I 
guess.

If he's telling the truth, Sei might 
have found a way out.

She's a resourceful girl. She surely 
did something.

I think I'll have another drink. Do 
you want anything?

Girl?
What?
Oh, don't worry.

Besides, the last thing I'm worried

Her attitude is usually so laid back

And on the off-chance that she has to

I once saw her take care of a warbot

She did need medical help afterwards,

take care of the 'bot.

She's not only really physically fit, 
she's also really good with Krav Maga and...

No, nothing. I just realized I 
forgot about all that.

Sei's not invincible, but she knows 
how to take care of herself.

And like I said, she's resourceful. 
She surely found a way out.

*sigh* I just hope she's well

...she owes me an ice cream.

You want another drink, Mr. Von 
Delay? It's on me.
Yeah, order away.
I'm fine. Get his order.

That's because you got a woman

Because that's not a musician at all.

He made my night with his

I'm not totally over it, but at

Thanks again.

You don't mind if I stay a bit

I'll just go sit over there near

Ah, Brian. Fancy meeting you here.
Sure, no problem.
Jill, we'll be sitting over here.

Ah Jill, I'll be taking my leave

Excuse me, have we met somewhere

What about my eye, punk?!
Apparently.
Well. I'm off. Thanks for everything.

Riots...? Oh! Nonono... You're thinking

No, we're different people. I mean...

In fact, you could say we deal with

"To rescue, heal, and protect! We are

"We are the light of hope in the darkest

"We watch, we protect."

Sorry, it's sort of our pledge of

What it means is that our duties mostly 
include rescuing civilians, healing the

Burglars, rapists, car crashes, anything

Nah. I know many doctors, but I'm not

I'm also kinda like a firefighter in

Sort of, but it's also really rewarding.

I mean, I've yet to meet somebody that

Yeah! This one time, when I was saving

I looked down and was blown away by how

Oh! And there was this time we were

With the lights and scattered pieces of

No? But those are sights... and they're

Wait... did I mishear and you actually

I've suffered the deepest, longest and

What kind of answer?

Don't make it too big. Does that work?

Sorry, I don't come to bars very often.

She's my dearest friend. Not that I

Say, Miss Bartender, what's your name?

Jill... hm... Jill...

Jill is short for... Jillian! No, that's

Jillian... Ju... Julianne!

No, please excuse me. I didn't want to

Um... but why don't you like being

Oh, ok. I still feel bad about angering

Because you look like a nice girl, 
Jill, and I don't like angering nice

If it helps somehow, I really like 
this place.
The smell of dog urine and soap!

My mom used to be a veterinarian, and I 
used to go to her clinic after school, so 
the smell takes me back.
It makes me feel... comfy and nostalgic.

Well, I was never a good student, so 
studying medicine of any kind was out of 
the question.

That aside, it's mostly because of 
something that happened while I was a kid.

A White Knight attacked my friend and 
was coming for me when this other White

I don't remember what happened next. I 
just woke up in a hospital with my friend

I mean, it wasn't a prophetic moment or

That I wanted to help people the same 
way they helped me.

Yeah, but it was another one that saved

So I kinda guide myself toward judging

Well, not to an extremist extent,

Because I wanted to rescue people 
from dire situations whenever 
possible.

And going into patrols and all that

It's also the one with the least 
paperwork involved.

I guess 'White Knight' is too broad a

There's not one specific type - there

There's even a squad full of 
bureaucrats.

Yeah, they get assigned to companies to

People usually ask for them because

But a few are assigned when a company is

There was also a squad dedicated to 
fighting school bullying.

They were doing a nice job, but the 
"fad" of anti-bullying campaigns passed

I believe some members still work with 
anti-bullying cases in an unofficial 
capacity.

I don't know if I should. I can't afford

Bye!

Yeah... I've seen that firsthand.

Oh yeah, that too.

That's something that stuck with me,

She's not a cheapskate by any means,

At best, she scolds you for not doing

At worst, she rambles about the

So, any time I see something that

I can't speak for other rich people,

Well, it's about the other one.

We were at the park and he held us

At one point, they tried to approach

I tried to stop him, but he just went

I still remember that kick. I could

Apparently the kick ruptured a couple
