I bring this up because that guy that 
was here last time I came...
...I think he's the one that saved us.

Sure, more pounds and years, but I'm 
pretty sure it's him.

There's something about his face I 
just can't dismiss.

I'd like to see him again. Do you 
know how?
Gotcha!

Hey Jill, this might seem a bit 
random, but...

Do you remember the first time I came 
here?
Precisely because of that.

I've been meaning to ask you about 
that story. How was your other experience 
with a White Knight?
Oh?
What kind of case was it?

You seem to be pretty good at reading 
people, Jill.
It makes me kinda jealous.
But you noticed it.

I'm not good at reading people. Even 
if the cue was thrown in my face, I 
wouldn't be able to see it.

Not really. I just found the fact 
that I was the only other White Knight 
you've served... weird.
I mean... really? Just two?
Means you've had a nice life then!

...that sounded creepier than I 
thought.

Well, I'm done for today. Thanks, 
Jill!
Sorry I'm late!!
Yeah, sorry! Sorry.

I got caught in rush hour traffic too 
and figured walking might be faster.

Luckily, there was a building with 
emergency stairs nearby and I climbed 
down.
Took an air cab.

Safety? No, no... flying cars are just 
way cooler.

If I find out how I avoid it, you'll 
be the first to know.

Anyway, I'll have whatever she orders 
next.

You're at it again? You and your 
cryptic orders always leaving us with weird 
stuff.

Still, I'm sure you're wearing poor 
Jill here out with that kind of stuff.
Really?

Whatever. Please order something normal, 
would you?
You'll have two drinks at once?

What? Like half a glass for each? Isn't 
it better if it's one for each?
So?

Oooooh, that way. You could've said so 
earlier.

Here, you have the Fringe whatever. 
I'm fine with the other drink.

See? You made Jill give us other stuff 
because you've been too picky.

Hey! So this is where I left my helmet. 
Thanks!
E-Eh?
I-It's okay, I have a couple of spares.
I'll be fine, I'll be fine...

Wait... does this have something to do 
with me going to the bank tomorrow?

You're still worried about rumors of 
those Harbinger guys?

Don't be. You know that even if they 
do come, I can take care of them!

If I could ditch the meeting tomorrow, 
I would. But I have to go to that bank.
We'll have ice cream.

Sleep for a bit. I'll wake you up when 
we leave.

Sorry, I don't think she's allowed to 
sleep here, huh?
Sorry.

She's always been a spoiled kid. I 
guess alcohol brings it out.

What was that Latin phrase again? 
Vini Vidi Vici?
Memento Mori? Carpe Diem?

No... it was something like... In Vino 
Termitas.
Yeah! That's the one.
Yeah, but I have spares!
Yeah. Sorry...
Yup. You worried?

Don't be! It'll be fine. Rumors are 
just rumors.

They say something might happen at the 
bank tomorrow.

But with all the tension in the air 
lately, it's hard to know if it's true.

As if the fear mongering wasn't 
enough, the people have also started 
spreading baseless rumors.

Just yesterday I had to stop a group of 
rampaging youngsters that heard the city 
would be leveled by bombs.
*sigh* Everyone's on edge.

I know you're worried, but I have to go 
there. It's orders from the higher ups.

Tell me something. If somebody came 
after me, do you think they'd stand a 
chance?

I'll take something to protect myself, 
be prepared for anything.
Would that make you feel safer?

I'll tell you what, after I come back 
we'll get some ice cream. That way you can 
vent all your frustrations.
Nah, I'll stay here a bit longer.
Bye.
She's such a worrywart.
I've never doubted.

Say... why does my helmet smell like 
bacon?
Not that I mind. I'm just curious.
I see.

To tell you the truth, I am a bit 
worried.

Even in my division, there's some shady 
business going on. But I don't want to 
investigate too deeply.

From what I understand... things like 
working with human traffickers or drug 
dealers, letting them act as they wish.

Some even say the ones that do get 
apprehended are the ones that have failed 
them in some way.

Stella always says "the White Knights 
are just glorified mall security."

She says that if it's been proven 
beyond a doubt that some shady business is 
going on...

Zaibatsu Corp's main branch would 
separate themselves from the whole White 
Knight division.

Something about the associates' fear of 
bad PR resulting in them moving to the BTC.

Yeah. It kinda worries me, though, 
because I really like my job.

And I guess a similar fear exists among 
the upper ranks. Lately they seem... 
restless.

It hurts my brain. I just want to 
rescue people and help them.

I just wanna do my job without worries 
about politics of any kind.

My colonel needed to relay some 
information to the manager, and I was 
picked because he trusted me.

Well, he said "You're such a simpleton 
that you'd never give the wrong message", 
but it's his intention that counts.

Hey, you having a drink? Can I buy 
you one?
I'll have what she's having.
One for both?
Hey, this is pretty good.
It is!

You have the Fairy. I'm fine with the 
other.
Don't worry.
I don't know. I like it.
Call me Sei.
Yes yes?
Yes yes?

I just thought you were cute as a button 
so I wanted to invite you to join me.
How so?
Thank you!

You seem very perceptive, Dorothy. But 
I'm not too far behind!

I can tell your body is heavily modded 
with things you shouldn't even have.

Your tongue is a BEB069 with DNA 
scanning capabilities.

Your skin is coated with an 
anti-radiation finish.

Your joints are of the premium, 
extra-flexible variety.

And the most important thing... your 
hands.

I don't know how modded your body is 
under your clothes. The tongue, joints and 
skin are merely interesting.

But your hands are the MIRD113 of Realta 
Industries...

A model designed to shoot Class-5 
bullets from its fingertips.

Clause G of article 17 in the 
Augmentations and Modifications law on the 
topic of ballistic augmentations.

"Any humanoid or sapient creature under 
civilian designation that has upgraded any 
of its person...

...to hold fire arms of Class-3 grade or 
higher will be either commissioned for 
disarmament or sent to danger zones."
Nothing.

I'm not in law enforcement. I just do 
rescue. And even if I was, I'm not on duty 
right now.

I want to know, though. Why go 
through with that upgrade?
Oh! Yeah, yeah.
Okay then. Can I give you some advice?

The reason I could tell it's not your 
default hand model is your fingertips.

The tips are a little bigger to make 
the cannons fit.

You could get a small mod that changes 
them into disposable tips.

...assuming they're being used for 
self-defense and not regular use, of 
course.

Well, I've gotta go. Ah yes, another 
thing.

If you aim for the arms or legs, once 
is self-defense. Anything more is assault.
Let's go, Stella.
Bye folks!
Bye Dorothy! Bye Jill!
Hello Jill!
Nice seeing you too!

Well, I fell from a really tall place 
to a really rough spot.
I just got out of one, don't worry.

It was a bit rough. Luckily these 
bandages helped me conceal my identity! 
Heheh...

The ambulance where I got treatment 
couldn't stray too far away from the 
hospital.

They're nice people, I've talked to 
them a lot while on rescue duties.

I was nearby and yours was the closest 
friendly face I could find.

I needed to regain my composure before 
doing anything else, so... here I am.

Um... if you're scared because they 
might come for me I can leave, you know?

Slow... Slow down a bit... The 
medications make me feel everything 
more intensely, almost like a hangover.

It's nice to know someone like a 
bartender was worried about me though. 
Thanks.

Everyone I know has been ignoring me, 
so I was feeling lonely.

Well, you've seen the lynches they give 
to any White Knight they find.

By ignoring me, they're actually 
saving me from getting kicked to death.

My good deeds finally paid off, I 
guess... heheh...
Um... something sweet without alcohol.

Thank god these pants still had my 
wallet in them.
Jill, please. I wanna pay for my drinks.

Nope. I mean yes. I mean... You won't 
be able to change my mind.
Yay! This'll help me calm down a bit.
It burns a bit...

I was escaping the place near the end 
of the whole thing, and I had to make a leap 
of faith.

I've jumped from higher places, but I 
landed badly here.

Most of my injuries are actually from 
some debris that fell on me.

Oh, but my broken arm is actually from 
the fall.

I rolled to mitigate the fall, but I 
made a bad move and broke it.
Good thing I drink lots of milk!

I was under rubble for quite a bit, 
but luckily someone found me.

I woke up in the hospital, they told me 
some guy brought me there.

I don't know who he was, but I owe him 
my life.
W-What?
I'm alive! Why wouldn't I be?

After all that happened at the bank, 
here I am, talking to you. Being able to 
talk at all.

Don't think too much about it. I'm fine! 
I'm totally
fi-owowowowowow...
Eh... um...

H-How were things around here? I heard 
there was a huge commotion when the whole 
thing happened.
Glad to know that.
Eh... um...

H-Hey Jill! I want another drink! A... 
uh... um... a Bleeding Jane!
C-Cheers! Nf...
Phew...
Thanks!
Eh... um...
I-I'll save it for later.
*cough* *cough* Come again?

Um... I was with this nice bunch of 
people. Well... they were apparently nice 
at the very least.

We tried our best to find a way out of 
the whole thing, cracking through the 
security, finding safe spots.
But then...
Um...

N-No, don't worry about it. It's just 
the analgesics still numbing me.

I'll take my leave now. Thank you for 
everything, Jill.
I'm fine, I'm fine.
Um...
Yeah, I was but... well...
You know how I just said I was fine?
I-I'm not.

So I wanted to know if you could lend 
me your ear for a bit.
Oh sorry...
Y-Yeah, please...

Sorry, I haven't smoked since high 
school.
But don't mind me though. Smoke ahead.

You're the closest friend I have nearby 
that isn't avoiding me and.. and I think 
I'm about to explode.

B-B-Because I'm afraid! I'm terrified! 
I'm scared!

My colonel was using me when I made 
that errand, he saw me as a disposable pawn!

Then the whole thing got closed at the 
bank.

We were stuck there with no food or 
water for three days!

I-I saw a man be beaten to death after 
he found some snack in his pocket... that... 
that...

When I was in rescue duties I usually 
dealt with collapsing buildings, fire, 
that kind of stuff.

B-But seeing people do that to other 
people is just...
I... *sniff* I...
You sure?
Is it obvious?

Well, I had to get outta there. Fear 
would've only gotten in the way.

And besides, I made a promise to come 
back to...
Err...
Nothing, I'm just...

The word loses meaning after using it 
so much in so little time.

She should've been worried sick, and I 
couldn't call her after I came back. I'm 
afraid of what she will say.
Yeah... you're right.

I wouldn't pretend to disappear, I 
mean...
Yeah.

It's weird how everything can change in 
such a short notice, you know?

On Thursday I was a girl doing her 
duties minding only her own business.

Now I'm injured and woke up to find out 
I can't go back to those duties.

Part of me is happy, I knew full well 
White Knights usually did more harm than 
good.

On the other hand, I really loved my 
job. Now I'm stuck with nothing to do.
Really?
Yeah, you're right.
R-Right!
Thank you for hearing me out, Jill!

*Kira* Miki.text:
Are you here, Jill? This song 
is for you!
This place... Great!

Hey, Jill! Sorry, but is 
there anywhere I can hide?

There's an unpleasant guy on 
my trail.
Thanks!
Oh, hi there!
Oh! Alright!

Thanks for sheltering me, 
Dana. Hope your sister likes the video!

Your boss is such a fun 
person.

Her sister is a fan of mine, 
so I recorded a small video for her and 
took a couple of photos.

It's nothing, really, and she 
did hide me, so it's the least I could do.

But, well, we're here 
already. Mind giving me something sweet?
Thanks!
Are you okay, Jill?

I don't, but I wasn't in the 
mood to deal with him.

His questions were a bit over 
the line last time, too.

Not the worst I've dealt 
with, but I just didn't want to humor him.
You don't say...

Well, not like he'd have a 
chance anyways.

I'm not into older guys and 
I'm already committed to a relationship.

It's not common knowledge and 
the ones that hear it try to dismiss it as 
rumors, but...

I've been in a relationship 
with my producer for a while now.

We were both single, and that 
kind of stuff is bound to happen when you 
spend so much time together.

But it all started when he 
read an entry I made in my blog about 
wanting to experience love and the like.

He offered to "help with 
that" after he read it and I thought 
"sure, why not?"

I already knew him well 
enough, it wouldn't hurt to try!

He's a stick in the mud where 
planning is due, but he's a sweetheart 
otherwise.
Really?!
Heheheh...

I don't like the term "fan" 
too much. It strikes me as a bit... 
pretentious, in my opinion.

"I have many fans" doesn't 
sit so well. I like "many people who like 
my music" better.

"Fan" evokes an uglier and 
more pretentious image for me.

...do you like what I do, 
Jill? Do you like my music?
So nice to hear!

Really? I haven't faced any 
issues lately.

Sure, they've tried to mug me 
once or twice, but it's no big deal.

Every time someone tries to 
mug me, somebody pops out of... somewhere 
and stops it.

Makes me feel like I'm always 
protected.

Hey, this will sound 
familiar, but do you have anything like 
tea?
Perfect!
Yeah, this works.
Too vague of an order, huh?
That, I am.
Sure!
Hm...

We both serve the same 
purpose, but...

DFC-72s have the port on 
their heads, which makes them more 
versatile.

My line lacks that or the 
resilience of the DT-01Ds, but we're a tad 
more polished elsewhere.

More specifically, our voice 
emulators are more advanced and our 
movements are smoother.

A trade off of functionality 
and power for appearance, you could say.

Hey Jill, will you go to my 
next concert?
Now you will!
Here!

It's a ticket for my encore 
concert!

Sorry it's not a better seat, 
but I only get so many free tickets.

You will. It even has a 
backstage pass so we can talk afterward 
and you'll tell me how it was!
I don't know, I like you.

You're attentive and hear me 
out. That behaviour should be rewarded 
more.

Don't think too much about 
it. You deserve it.

Although I guess I can 
understand how you feel about receiving 
gifts.

I usually get quite a few 
from fans but it always feels so... weird.

I don't like feeling as 
though I got something for free.

Luckily, I've thought of a 
way of not feeling so bad about it.
Just give it my all on stage!

They gave those gifts to me 
after watching me perform.

It's only natural for me to 
do my best and give it my all as a way to 
repay them.
Of course!

Hm... well, it is an encore, 
so we're trying to make it the same for 
those that couldn't go to the first one.

But we always try to spice it 
up, like maybe with a surprise song or 
something.

There was this one time I 
sang a cover of a song by b-LINK.

Of course, in return, they 
sang Your Love is a Drug.

Really nice kids. You'd be 
surprised how different from their onstage 
personas they are.

Suzu, for example, can be 
really childish at times. She also laughs 
a lot... and loudly at that.

Meanwhile, Aina is a party 
girl through and through.

If they're not on tour, she 
spends her time partying like crazy.

Well, they wanted to pop out 
in the public.

They once told me, "If we 
want people to notice us, we have to break 
the cutesy idol concept."

I wouldn't say they went the 
opposite way.

The opposite of cutesy idols 
would be unkempt, tone-deaf girls spewing 
vitriol and hate.

Well, I've gotta go, but 
let's have a Sparkle Star first.
Sparkling!

This isn't as shiny as I 
expected.

Well, it's always a pleasure, 
Jill.
Will do!

Oh! The handsome bartender! 
Nice to see you!
Yes! It's open. Great!

Good evening. Um... what kind of place 
is this?
Did I step into some kind of afterlife?
Sorta. Kinda. Yeah?
A bar? Nice! Nice!

I don't know... I don't drink that 
much, to be honest.
What do you recommend for me?
I like tea.
Bitter but not too bitter?
Sorry if it's too confusing.
Yup, this'll do just fine. Thanks!
*cough* A bit too strong for me.
Hey, I like this one!

But didn't you say you didn't have 
tea?

This doesn't taste like what I had in 
mind.

But then again, I wasn't clear with 
the order. Sorry.

I'm the star that always shines in the 
dark night sky!

I'm the glow that will guide you 
through your sorrow!

I'm the northern light that will show 
you your dreams!
I'm *Kira* Miki!

No, you're not getting it, 
I'm just *Kira* Miki.

Here, let me help you. I'll 
say Kira and you say Miki, okay?
Kira!

No no no no! Put more spirit 
into it!
Kira!
Almost there!
Kira!
Kira!
Kira!!
Kira!!
That's it! Are you feeling it?
Kira!!!
Kira!!!
Kira!!!
And don't you ever forget it!
Thank you!

It's nice to know I still 
have it.

Especially since I have a 
concert in a bit.

I'm ONE Lilim who is putting 
on a concert tonight. I don't know if I'm 
the same Lilim you're looking for.

Well, they were making last 
preparations for the concert so I snuck 
out.

My producer is always obnoxious 
while that's going on, so I just decided to 
leave.

I saw one of the concert's 
posters outside and decided to check this 
place.

He will, but it's not the first 
time I've done this.

And he still needs me to do the 
concert anyway.

We planned for a bit over 
100,000 people and sold out fast.

So, we managed to secure 
ourselves another show in a couple of 
weeks.

Yeah. I may not have as many 
fans as other performers, but mine are very 
loyal, and that's nice.

You don't get it! Let's start 
from the top.
Oh! I like that.

Hey, do you have anything... 
soft?
No, I meant soft as in soft.
Yeah, this'll do it. Thanks!

Hey, have you considered being 
more theatrical when mixing drinks?

Yeah, you know. Like spinning 
bottles and lighting drinks on fire. That 
kind of stuff.

Yeah, but never underestimate 
the power of putting on a good show.

It can feel incredible and be 
very rewarding, you know?

It isn't what I had in mind for 
soft...

But it'll work juuuuuuuust 
fine. Thanks!
Aw man, this isn't soft.
I'm gonna reek of alcohol.
Oh, I'll keep it in mind.
Hmhm...
Hey, is this glass important?
Do you want me to sign it?

No guessing! Are you sure or 
not?

Okay, then. Who should I make 
it out to?
Your name, girl!

"For Jill. Never lose your star. 
From *Kira* Miki."
Thanks!

Well, we're promoting my new 
single. It's called Shine Spark.

I say that, but people still 
look forward to my old single, "Your Love 
Is a Drug".

I'm worried I might become a 
one-note star, you know?

*ahem* Anyways, the tour is 
called Shining Star and we've been 
traveling the whole continent.

We sold out of tickets fast! 
So we decided to give an encore concert 
after all others are done.

But I'm not gonna bore you with 
details you'll find in tomorrow's newspapers 
anyways.

I got this awesome dress that 
looks all cat-like.

My hairdresser, Agnes, came up 
with a hairstyle that makes me look like I 
have cat ears and all!
Nothing! I just like cats.

My producer suggested a bunny 
though.

You know, if I hadn't ended up 
on stage singing, I'd probably be the one 
planning the pyrotechnics.

When you enter the stage and 
the sparks start flying... that's magical, 
you know?

No, not yet. I singed my hair 
once, but I just went for something short 
for a bit.

People seemed to love it. I 
should go back to it sometime.

Well, there are two kinds of 
people that obsess over me.

There are the shy ones that 
follow me everywhere, hiding just out of 
sight.
And then there's my fanclub.

The fanclub follows me around a 
lot too, but they usually keep a distance.

Actually, I think they're 
outside waiting for me right now.

They're also very organized. 
They'd make pretty good soldiers.

The others, the stalkers, are a 
bit sneakier and don't act in groups.
Actually, they're not that bad.

Stalkers are nice when you get 
used to them.

I remember one once protected 
me from being mugged.

There's another that breaks into 
my house once a week to make me breakfast.

I just wish they'd leave my 
underwear drawer the same way they find 
it.

I take pride in how neatly I 
organize my underwear, you know?
Yeah! You get me, Jill.

Okay, one more drink before I 
go.

By now, the stage should be 
all organized, so the fallout should have 
settled.

It's part of my gimmick. I 
always make concerts that go from night 
till dawn.

In this one, I'm supposed to 
close with a song called Sunshine Stone.

If everything goes as planned 
and the weather forecast is accurate...

The sun should come up just as I 
reach the climax of the song.

I'd be depressed if they ask 
for "Your Love Is A Drug" as an encore 
though...

Hey, I need to make people feel 
their tickets were worth the ridiculous 
price, you know?

Don't you think it sucks to 
pay for something, only to find out you 
shouldn't have bothered?
Man, that sucks.

Speaking of which, do you have 
anything bitter? I really need to wake 
myself up.
Yeah, this works.

It could be a bit sweeter but 
it's delicious.
Really nice, thanks!

This is good, but it isn't 
exactly what I needed.

Something that'll wake me up, 
or help me sober up a bit before going 
back.

...the order's still wrong 
though.
Hm?

I'll let you know that before 
becoming *Kira* Miki, I was a very 
accomplished pianist.

I had concerts every week and 
part-timed in bars with a jazz band.

I still write and compose my own 
songs!

Have you ever thought about the 
power music has over people?

You could argue it's just 
noise, but it can make you feel a wide range 
of emotions.

And that power is universal. 
It can transcend language and culture.

Being in a jazz band or 
performing recitals, I can only take that 
power to so many people.

But being an Idol, I can take 
that power and spread it far and wide!

Kids and adults, men and women. 
They all have access to my music, and I can 
reach every one of them!
What music do you like, Jill?
Why?
Oh, that's a bummer.

I'd give you a copy of my latest 
CD, but I don't have any at the moment.
Yeah! Lots!

I once said in an interview that 
I loved blue roses, so people started 
sending them to me!

No, silly. They're just dyed 
white roses. But they're so pretty!
Let's see...

A guy named Danny sent a 1/60th 
scale chocolate sculpture of me!

Her boobs were a bit smaller, 
though.

But... he did request a video 
of me eating it. I feel kinda guilty for 
not complying.

There was also this girl named 
Roxanne who sent me an oil painting, canvas 
and all!

It was a rendition of a photo 
from one of my swimwear photoshoots.

It was my favorite shot! Paul, 
the photographer, caught me while I was 
adjusting the bikini's top.
It just looks so natural...

Anyway, I still have that 
painting in my lobby.

I'm even considering 
commissioning Roxanne to do another one!

Calling me a goddess won't get 
you anywhere, you know?

You need to be more creative 
with your flattery.

There was an attempt that 
involved a sacrifice though... but the 
police solved that one quickly.

I try to remember as many of my 
fans' names as possible. I'd be a bad Idol 
if I didn't.
Okay then, I'm out.

Thanks for helping me pass the 
time, Jill!
I'll make sure of it!

Hey Jill, have you ever lost 
your identity?

No, I mean... your identity. 
Forgotten who you are.
I did.

*Kira* Miki is just an artist 
name.

At first, it was hard for me 
to play the part, you know?

But I gained so much 
satisfaction from the concerts that I 
decided to invest myself.
...and I overdid it.

I became so invested in the 
character that I forgot who I was.

Who was I before I became 
*Kira* Miki? What did I like?

Where does *Kira* Miki end and 
I begin?
I... just don't know anymore.

The fact that I know I'm 
performing a noble duty.

You have to deal with many 
stressful things in everyday life.

Work, debt, sickness, 
insecurity, the black slime that comes 
out of the sewers every full moon...

You don't know what will await 
you every morning.

You don't know if you'll make 
it back to bed that night.

When measured, the cons of life 
outweigh the pros.

People need something to cling 
to, and for many I'm that thing.

During my concerts, they stop 
being themselves for 4 hours.

They're not a nurse, an office 
worker, or a store clerk.

For those 4 hours, they're just 
part of the mass that goes to see an idol.

No religion, gender, or social 
class divides them. They're all at the 
same level.

When not in concert, I try to 
give them songs that will cheer them up, 
that will make their lives worth living.

When I see the people call my 
name from the stage, I know they're thanking 
me.

Thanking me for that single 
moment where they can be happy.

That's what I love about the 
stadium. I'm down below while they're up 
high.

If forgetting who I was before 
means that I can protect those smiles, SO 
BE IT!

I'll make that sacrifice as 
many times as needed.

Because I live for them. 
Because I know I help them.

I'm the star that always shines 
in the dark night sky!

I'm the glow that will guide 
you through your sorrow!

I'm the northern light that 
will show you your dreams!
I am *Kira* Miki!
And don't you ever forget that.
FANCLUB! TO ME!
We ride to the stadium!

Dorothy.text:
So yeah, the guy had a fantasy about 
a woman castrating him.

secret for so long?! Idiot! Idiot!

*sniff* I always told you everything. 
Wasn't I enough? You idiotic IDIOOOOOOOOT!
...Agh!

Hey, Jill! Promise me you won't be like 
that knucklehead. That you won't keep stuff 
like that to yourself.
And... And promise me we won't fight.
Eh?
I'm... not an adult.
Heheh...

Hey, did you mean what you said? That 
you'll look after me?
Jill...
H-Hey, wasn't this a toast?
Cheers!
Um, so...
About this drink...
Can I drink it?
...it's not bad.
R-Right.
O-Oh...
Oh yeah. That.

It was April Fool's. I should've known 
better when she offered me apple soda.

I put bubblegum on the soles of all 
her shoes in retaliation.

She walked funny. 
And my jaw hurt 
for the rest of the day.
Huh?
Oh.
Did you get back at her?
Jill?
They think I'm at Clarie's, actually.
Oh. She's my best friend at school.

Of course! How would she cover for me 
otherwise?

To be honest, I didn't think that 
far...

Maybe I will, I do live in another 
district, but Clarie doesn't live close 
by, so...
Hm...
A-Are you sure?
Sure! I'd love to stay with you!

Yup! He opened a second branch last 
year.

I think he got into a partnership with 
a friend in Motor District.

The guy saw an opportunity after 
realizing Motor District has almost no 
bakeries.

I think he had this bet with an 
acquaintance of his ever since my sis was 
12 years old or so.

Dad said sis was into girls. The 
acquaintance didn't believe him...

He bet a Beer on whether he was right 
or not.

...that Beer bottle is still in the 
fridge. It's even labeled "sweet victory".
*sigh*

I guess that one wasn't as simple as 
the "said one too many things" argument.

Mom was always obsessed with high 
society and in her circle of friends, a 
lesbian daughter was a no-no.

I'm still on my sis' side for that one, 
though.

Mom didn't reject her because she 
herself was homophobic, she did it because 
her friends were.

To mom, the opinion of her circle of 
friends was worth more than her own 
daughter.

Dunno, mom and dad broke up two years 
ago.

They never got married, so there was 
no proper divorce.

I haven't seen her since... August, I 
think.
No, she just hasn't showed up.

A bit, but I'm not alone anymore. 
Thanks to you.
Jill, I'm a bit dizzy...
The WHAT?!
Yeah, but...

If you're trying to justify your action 
with a moral, you're digging yourself 
deeper.
Party?
I-I don't want a kid to burden...
I think it's a bit late for that.
If you don't mind me...
Hey, Miss.
Are you happy?

No, I mean, are you happy with your 
life? With your choices?
Regrets?
I see...
Hey, Miss.
Do you recognize me?

Really? You can't remember your own 
sister's face?
Not even a "sister in law"?
...three years.

I actually had to transfer schools, and 
I managed to skip a grade thanks to the 
admission tests.
I'll be out of middle school next year.

I don't know yet. I guess I still have 
a couple of years to think about that.
She's dead.

My sister is dead, Jill. She died last 
Saturday. I came all the way to tell you 
the news.

No, YOU stop fooling around, I mean, 
WOW!

My sister was left to suffer her 
disease alone while you were all merry 
here, mixing drinks and chatting!

Localized Nanomachine Rejection. It 
gave her a heart attack.

She started complaining about chest 
pains not long after you left.

Was all the talk about getting your 
freedom worth it, Jill?

Was your right to be merry worth the 
life of my sister?!

No, but. It's too much of a coincidence 
that she started getting worse and worse 
right after you left!

She got visibly sick after your 
fight. It'd be no surprise if that 
fight played a key role in killing her!

And all of that because you wanted 
"freedom"?!

What kind of freedom is so 
enticing that it makes you hurt a 
nice three-year-old relationship?!

Was this freedom so important you cut 
all contact with us?!

Was this freedom so good you left 
everything behind?!

Was this freedom worth the life of 
my-...
...idiot.

Gillian.text:
I guess this is where we part ways, 
huh?

Sadly, I'm bound to this city. I 
can only falsify my identity effectively 
around here.

I really want to thank you, Chief, 
for this second chance you gave me.
If we ever cross paths again, I-...

But I already know. They're in that 
control panel you made.
Do you think Chief knocked her out?

We'll just need to keep it quiet. 
She seems to be just sleeping soundly, not 
comatose.
Okay then. Time to start the night!
Just that? Fine. I see no problem.

...you brought that from home, 
didn't you?

I'M DOING MY BEST HERE, THANK YOU 
VERY MUCH!

What the hell happened in that 
bathroom?

That kind of mess usually requires 
you to have THUMBS!

T-The ceiling... the sinks... the 
toilets... THE VENTS!

There was this time in Zanzibar 
when that almost happened. In any case, I'll 
go check that noise.

I'll go check that noise! If you 
hear me scream, lock down the bar!

I'll go check what the everloving 
hell that explosion was.

Two flying cars crashed and went 
boom. That's why it was so noisy.

A hole in the street, dunno about 
the drivers or anything.
Either way, I think I'm done here.
What about i-... OH MY GOD!

Hey Jill, bathroom's done. I'm 
leaving.

Excuse me Miss, please help me walk 
you to your cab.

Those dogs left a mess I'm not 
gonna forget any time soon.

I mean, how the hell did they throw 
toilet paper out the window?!

Jill, I'm gonna leave early. I need 
to take care of the smell clinging to my 
body.

You sure you should've come then? 
You're in all the right to stay at home.

You're the one who looks like 
she's about to fall apart.
Your eyes are red and swollen.

It was me. I was the one washing 
dishes yesterday, remember?

Why don't you go home, Jill? 
You're in no position to deal with people 
right now.

See? You're starting to sound 
like a broken record.

Then why not have Jill stay, but 
not serve anyone today?

*sigh* What do we do if she 
lashes out at a client?
Oh, you already put on music.

*sigh* This is gonna be an 
interesting day.
No, but just leave her be for now.

I believe she went outside to 
look for that Stella girl or something.

You should take some of that 
advice for yourself.

Let's call it a day for now. You 
need some rest.

So, on a scale from "steaming 
pile of shit" to just "sad", where are you?
How did you get her number?

I'd make you the same offer, but 
I'm guessing hugs from me are the last 
thing you want.

If you need a bartender, let me 
know though.
Heh, it's nice to hear that again.

I'll still get paid for today, 
right?

...you just wanted to ask me 
something right? Okay then. Truth.

I don't think so. I don't even 
know any Madame Laverne.
No, I'm the one that dares you.

I-I don't know what you're 
talking about.

"How can a clam cram in a 
crean-..." Agh!

I know of a Joseph Shine, but not 
Valentine.
Hey, Chief. Can you drop me?
No, I'm the one that dares you.

You have a pretty triumphant look 
on your face though.

Hm... how strong are those arms 
of yours?
I just wanted to make sure.

I dare you to break this nut with 
your hands.

Gil-... wait, that was close this 
time.

Ah, yeah. The person that got me 
into Glitch City is part of it, actually.

You're just spinning yourself on 
the chair.
That's not what I had in mind.

I do shave, but... I use an 
electric razor.
And set it quite low, so...

This is something I've been 
meaning to ask for a long time.

Why is the bar called Valhalla if 
your designation is "VA-11"? Shouldn't it 
be "VA-1"?

To be honest... I just wandered 
aimlessly for some time.

Stuff happened and I went from 
place to place.

Eventually, I came across the 
city and stumbled upon the bar.

Try reading that sign without 
your glasses.
So you can see without them?

...Jill, it's a hypothetical 
scenario. And it's a cat.

*sigh* Whatever. You take it from 
here, Jill.
You were comparing me to a pic?!
Can I at least see it?

It's one of those things I can't 
remember or was never informed about.

Strangely, I do remember an early 
childhood in the Arctic of all places.

You are a pretty cheerful girl, 
Dorothy.

Chief... well, I pretty much owe 
you everything for giving my life any 
semblance of order.

Alma... you can be a really 
caring person.

And Jill... you're a pretty smart 
girl.

...you could always say that more 
frequently, you know?

*sigh* Anyways. What do you pick, 
Alma?

What's the most embarrassing 
thing that has happened to you while drunk?

I don't have that many clothes to 
begin with.

Jamie came earlier too. The dogs 
went with him to get some ice.
Don't be rude with poor Will!

Now I've gotta "patrol with the 
dog", or whatever.

Which means standing outside the 
alley and giving out flyers.

So, yeah. Give me a call if you 
need something. I'll be nearby.

Dog duty done. I know we have 
slow days, but for god's sake...

It's not like I have anything 
else to do, so...

Oh yeah, the kid from the other 
day - Gaby, I think you called her - asked 
me to give you this.

Oh yeah, she asked me when would 
you be here and relatively free. So I told 
her about the party.

I also assumed you'd say yes to 
the party, which might not have been the 
best idea, now that I think about it.

I don't how she'll cook it. 
Perhaps she'll chop it?

And you're the one trying not to 
laugh too hard at them.

Anyway, we all know if we dare 
cook this without her permission, she'll 
hang us upside down.

There's the belief that some 
Lilim out there are designed to perfectly 
replicate a particular human.

That someone or something 
replaces those humans with such Lilim.

I don't, it's in most magazines 
nowadays.

What's your take on the replibot 
thing? Do you believe in them?
Not really, but I asked you first.

...Jill, are you still afraid of 
aliens?

Even for a cat lover, you sure 
get excited about firecrackers a whole 
lot more when dogs are involved.

I add a couple of extras in his, 
actually.

...you were quite absorbed in the 
conversation just now.

Jamie even said goodbye to you, 
didn't you hear?
Jill, a kid's looking for you.
Hey, Jill. Mind helping me here?

You okay, Jill? Making a lot of 
faces there.

Could you give me a hand here and 
serve a Beer, please?
Man, she was in a rush.

I'll make sure there's an extra 
extinguisher at hand.

Hey Jill, mind if I ask a silly 
question?

Do you know why they call them 
"Cat Boomers"?

I mean, I guess their second set of 
ears look like a cat's but...

The word "Boomer" seems so out of 
place.

Because they went through some 
anti-Nanomachine Rejection treatment 
while they were still a fetus, right?

And their parents got called 
Cat Boomers?

You keep calling them Protrusions, 
why is that?

Let's say I learned quite a bit 
today. Thank you.
And did you need to shout just now?
I have no idea who that is.

You're not gonna say anything, 
Jill?

...if I told you she did, would 
you believe me?
Hm? Nothing of the sort. I'm fine.
Do I have something in my face?
Hm? No thanks, I don't smoke.
Tell her I said thanks... I guess.

I don't feel comfortable talking 
about that, you know?

You make me sound like some weird 
loner.

I looked up her discography 
and... I can't stop humming or listening 
to them.

No. Why would that be a problem, 
though?

Listening to you say that has to 
be the weirdest thing I've heard this 
year.
Man, don't you just feel great?
I'M NOT GOING BACK TO HONG KONG!!!

S-Sorry, I thought you were someone 
else.
What the hell is a "John Face?"

I-I've never been to Hong Kong... 
and I certainly didn't defect from any 
anti-riot force after stealing supplies.

I've heard Chief call her a 
couple of times. Maybe she's a friend?

More importantly, will Chief be 
fine?

I was... dealing with some stuff 
over the weekend.
I'd rather not talk about it.

It would happen less if Jill would 
just let people call her Jules.

I'll be with you in a minute, Jamie. 
Just let me finish here.

Wait! Don't leave! Just ignore 
her... stories... dammit!

Pluckiness, my ass! The client she 
scared off always leaves nice tips!

Sorry, can you take care of him 
while I help her?

Good news, Jill. The helmet came 
off and you can take your break.

Do you think she's telling the 
truth?
What was all that talk then?

Still quite the motivational 
performer, though.

She went out for a bit. I don't 
know what for, but she'll be back.

...you guys do know I can hear you, 
right?

Yeah, I'm just gonna take my break. 
Seems my allergies have started acting up.

Artificial intelligence has come 
rather far, eh? One wonders how artificial 
it remains.

Now that you mention it, I remember 
this one time she tried to eat a big 
sandwich and her jaw got stuck.

Then there was the incident with the 
TV...
Seems you made it just in time.

Really? It sounded more like a 
gunshot to me.
Haven't we all at some point?
I don't know... It's too dry.

Nah, it sounded too hollow for 
firecrackers.

I-I don't know what you're talking 
about.

I don't. I certainly don't and I'm 
offended by the suggestion that I do.

Something heavy? Come on! That's not 
even close!

They've always been a neutral and 
important third party in other gangs' deals.

I think I heard something about 
money laundering through bars.
Don't take my word for it though.
Why didn't you give her your name?

Should you be saying that with at 
least 6k people listening?

Boss, I'm leaving early. If I don't 
come back in two days, consider me as good 
as dead.

I have a copy of the key, 
remembe-...

Wait, that's how you greet me after 
so many days?!

What? Are you gonna make me wash 
the bathrooms again?
When it comes to you, I don't know.

Antenna's fine. Did I miss 
anything?
Are you okay? Your face is red.

Antenna's fine. Did I miss 
anything?

Yes! That's my name. I'm Robert, 
the one and only.

I'm surprised you haven't met him 
before.

Detective guy comes in, Cat Boomer 
girl greets him. They start talking...

Everything was okay until the girl 
mentioned Zaibatsu Corp offhand.

After that, the guy got riled up 
and started badmouthing it.

Oddly enough, he was the only one. 
She just carried on like it was just a 
normal conversation.

She left saying she had something 
to do.

Yup, quite a few clients considering 
the whole situation.

Yup, Chief got me a small 
apartment nearby. Something about 
the BTC housing program.

Cleaning? That'd be a change of 
pace.

That girl saw some awful things 
inside that bank.

The sight of desperate people 
stuck in one building is enough to scar 
anyone.
That's not something I can measure.

You were just worried. I bet she's 
just still in shock.

Want me to make sure she's fine on 
her way?

Only if you cover my share of the 
work.

That Cat Boomer girl picked her 
up.

I couldn't see anything, but I 
guess she was happy.
You didn't bring your cat today?

Nah, she's just like that all the 
time.

In the end you did humor her for a 
bit.

In the end, he's just a dog, I 
guess.

He didn't look like a "Mario" to 
me.
That girl has seen some shit.

Do you think she really can't access 
calendars and calculators that easily?

Why didn't you tell her you missed 
her yesterday?

Maybe the bar got popular at some 
middle school?
How would bartending become a fad?

Kids' cartoons don't show any 
alcohol.

She's not ordering anything, she's 
not causing trouble and there's nothing 
inappropriate here.

I mean, nothing inappropriate aside 
from alcohol. But alcohol is everywhere 
anyways.

Let her be? Maybe she's just curious 
about the bar.

Also, it's rude to speak about 
people you have in front of you like they 
can't hear you.
How the hell did I startle you?
Can you help me out here with a Beer?

Thanks. And lower your guard a bit, 
please.
Could you relax? It's just a girl.

The disposal unit comes on Sunday. 
Do you have any expired ingredients on your 
side?

Put it by the sink so I remember to 
dispose of it.
...again? Aren't you a bit on edge?

Didn't you borrow the screwdriver 
the other day?

I forgot to take the coins from 
the arcades in the corner last week.
So I need it to take them out.

Chump change is still money. Pocket 
change has saved my ass many times.

That only happened once and the old 
lady started it!

For the reason arcades still exist. 
Nostalgia.

So you actually had a relationship 
with something that's not a cat? Color me 
surprised!

I'll make sure that girl gets to 
wherever she wants to go safely.
When you let people call you Jules.
Are you okay? You look distracted.

Dunno. She went out to buy some 
stuff and...
Did you hear what I just told you?

Yes. That you look distracted. Very, 
very distracted.

Let's go through the basics, then, 
shall we? Just in case.

If you can make a Piano Man, I'll 
skip the rest. But. Bear with me for a 
second here, okay?
Let's start with a Sugar Rush.

Look for the recipe using the 
navigation bar in the recipe book that 
will show up on the top left.

You can also sort drinks by flavors 
like "Sweet" or types like "Manly".

Drag the desired amount of 
ingredients from their cells on the right 
to the shaker in the center.

When done, press the mix button, 
and then press it again to stop mixing.

Click the serve button or the drink 
itself to serve it and that'll be all.

Oh, but if the drink looks messed 
up, you'll need to press the Reset button 
and try again.

You can press Reset at any time. 
Even while the Shaker is moving. Don't be 
afraid to use it.
Then this should be no problem!

A little, but not quite. Let's do 
one more.

I know, I know. Please humor me for 
a bit.

You... spent too much time mixing. 
It got blended and became a Sparkle Star 
instead.
This is... not a Sugar Rush
Some drinks need to be blended.

This is done by mixing it for over 
five seconds. You can tell it's being 
blended when the shaker starts moving faster.

You also need to check if the drink 
should be served on the rocks or aged.

Check Ice and Age buttons on the 
side to select the one you need.

And in case it wasn't obvious. 
"On the rocks" means you have to toggle 
the "Ice" tab.

It should be noted that the 
station will add the ice after mixing.

It's not something you should 
mind though. Just a fun fact.

Give me a Moonblast and I'll leave 
you alone.
Keep in mind what I said!
You did. Sorry to hold you.

Huh, you actually made the Piano 
Man.

I was gonna leave you alone after 
this one, but good to see it done.

You didn't blow everything when 
mixing. Let's leave it at that. We need to 
start working.

You can make any drink big by 
doubling the amount of ingredients.

But if the recipe already has over 
10 ingredients, the drink is already big.

Oh, and if a recipe says it uses 
"Optional Karmotrine" it means you can use 
none or fill it to the brim.

Optional Karmotrine doesn't count 
towards making a big drink, of course.

Karmotrine is the alcoholic factor 
in a drink. It doesn't change the taste 
but the amount still has an effect.

If you add too much of it, the 
client will get drunk faster. So please 
be mindful of that.

Dana.text:
Gil, we're leaving for like, a week and 
a half or something. Don't be so dramatic.

AND you're taking care of my apartment. 
We WILL cross paths because I live there.

The time you spend setting up a 
useless farewell could be used asking me 
things about the place.
Like where the switches and valves are.

But I like talking about that control 
panel. I'm proud of it.
Speaking of obsessive likes...

Jill! Stop calling Armitage! She'll 
take care of your Fore Ball just fine.

You'll do just fine. You did pretty 
well for at least 25 years before finding 
him.
WE'RE LEAVING!
Oh yeah, before I forget.

I left you a box of condoms on the 
first drawer of the desk, Gil.

Hey, if he wants to bring his new 
girlfriend or whatever here, I want him 
to be ready!

Oh, but just one condition. If you're 
gonna fuck like rabbits, stay away from my 
room.

I have too many pics of my imouto there 
and I don't want their eyes soiled.
Little sister.
Yeah, whatever.
First stop, Panama!
Hey Jill, come here a sec.
Why don't you take a seat?
Take a seat. Over there.

Are you okay? You're not just spamming 
the easiest drinks, right?

Why don't you go home today? Get some 
rest, I'll take it from here.
Don't you ButtBoss me, young lady.

I need you in top form for the whole 
team.
Get some rest, clear your mind.
I'm sending you to the bench, soldier.

Jill, why don't you take the rest of 
the day off?

I have reasons to believe you've been 
just spamming the easiest drinks over and 
over again.
You most certainly have.

Don't worry, I'll take it from here. 
Just get some rest, will you?
Oh, and... leave the rum.

That's um... punishment. Yeah, let's 
go with that.
Hey Jill.
Let's go out for a bit.

You've been spamming easy drinks for 
too long.

Come on. Come here. Gil will take care 
of the fort while we hang out.
JIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIILL!!

I was... and I came back because 
you've been slacking off!

Yes! You've been serving easy drinks 
one after the other, haven't you? Wrong 
drinks at that.

I just know. Just like I know you 
should take a rest.
I'll take it from here.

Then go get some rest or I shall 
taunt you a second time.
Jill, you need to stop.

You can't just go serving easy drinks 
that aren't even the right ones are even 
trying?
Why the smirk?
...it's the helmet, isn't it?

Just go home, you're grounded for 
today, young lady.
Hey, guys!

I don't know. Found her while I was 
out shopping.

Well, it was either leave her outside 
at the mercy of society's finest or bring 
her unconscious body in here.

That's up for you to deal with. I'll 
be in my office.

There're two of you! Believe in 
yourselves!

Hey Jill, where did you put the dish 
soap? Gil's run out.
Right.

Oh! A customer. Good evening, sir. Hope 
you enjoy your stay at Valhalla.
Alright.
Are we done for the night?

Where's Gil? And... where's the girl 
that was here?
So she's called Kim.
How did she look to you? How was she?
Wouldn't you be?
Hm? Not really, no.

It's not like you call me that because 
I'm a stranger. Just out of habit.

Anyway, you're free to go after you 
finish washing up the glasses.

Let me transfer you today's payment. 
Maybe I'll give Gil a small bonus for 
dealing with the bathroom.

Oh, leave her be. I'd rather have her 
here than be alone in her apartment.
How are you feeling, Jill?
You're spirited, that's good.
Working with CIRA.
I know what I said.

In any case, let Jill process her 
anger. It's perfectly normal to feel that 
way.

And here, she's surrounded by people 
that care about her.

That's a lot better than leaving her 
to fend for herself.

I mean, as smart as Fore might be, 
he's still just a cat.

That's why you're here, Gillian 
Pliskin.
Hey Jill.

I'll be in my office, but if you 
need a break or a hug, just tell me.
I paid her to do that.

To put it simply: Dorothy will go 
home with you and she won't leave your 
side.

Well, at first it was to calm that 
rage you had earlier.

It was either hugs or a cold 
bucket... and I don't promise there'll 
be any water in it.

You calmed down a bit. But honestly, 
I know better than to leave you alone for 
another night.

At the very least, all the cuddling 
will give you an epiphany or something.
It's not. You need hugs. Many.

You need some human... err... 
humanoid contact right now.

You had your alone time. Now, we're 
playing by my rules.
So, how were things last night?

Well, if you wanna call that 
payment, I guess.

I called Dorothy to tell her what 
happened to you and she was really 
concerned.

She stuttered for a second saying 
that she had the whole night to go and she 
couldn't just leave for free.

I asked her how much and she said, 
"Enough to pay for this soda I'm having is 
fine."
I have... contacts.

Anyways, Jill. If you need a second 
break, a drink or a hug... just let me 
know, you hear?

I know what I said earlier, but you 
haven't even started yet!
Ah, Nacho.
Are you staying for a while?
Great! Gil can go with you.
You WILL.
That depends on Nacho's evaluation.

Oh, I'm paying him anyways, by the 
way. Just wanted to mess around with him.

Gil looked like he needed to take a 
good break, and he's the kind to just not 
accept such a thing.

But with Nacho, he'd have SOMETHING 
to do. AND he'd be away from the bar for a 
bit.
Anyway, I'm going back to my office.
Alright.
Hmhmhm... you silly girls.

You're there talking about breasts 
and legs when everyone knows the best 
parts are the WINGS.
Spicy chicken wings.
From a Spicy Chicken.

You know, Spicy Chicken, the shop 
two blocks from here.

Why AREN'T you carrying a bucket of 
spicy chicken wings?
Thought as much.
Yo, Armitage.
I know what I said.

Will the chicken you're talking 
about be cooked already?

Great! I expect you here Sunday at 8 
P.M.
Anyway, I'll be back to my office.
That Alma girl sure is nice.

Not all of it, but a good chunk, at 
the very least.

Your expression changed a lot 
already.
You look happier. That's always good.

Anyway, let's call it a day. I 
expect an even brighter Jill tomorrow.

Fucking idiots at the Spicy 
Chicken...

"Sorry Dana, we won't have enough 
spices for your order until tomorrow." they 
said.

Is that how they treat their 
regulars?... *mumble* call the manager 
*mumble*...
Ah. Hey, Jill.
How are you feeling?
That's nice to hear.

Nah, I have him on errand duty, 
buying the drinks for tomorrow.

Every drink from here would come out 
of our own funds.

So if we're gonna spend money, we 
might as well get more variety.

Besides, those kind of walks are 
always good for Gil.

Well, there's the three of us, the

...I'll let you off the hook this 
time.
And you managed to mess it up! Bravo!
So, where's the Red Comet?
You have a dog here? And a cat?

Heh, I remember my daughter wanted a 
cat.

I told her she couldn't have one but 
she went and fed some stray that passed by 
the house.
Mozart, she called him.

Even after all these years, that cat 
still passes by the house from time to time.

Hunts a couple of birds, sleeps in a 
tree on the yard and leaves.

My wife is devils-know-where and my 
daughter is playing with her grandparents.

How pathetic can I be when the only 
creature that hasn't left me is some 
fucking stray cat?!
What? Are you a stray too?
Figures.

Alright, I'm gonna take my leave 
here.

I don't like eating or drinking 
surrounded by animals and that cat.
As if.

He looks well groomed and his fur 
looks healthy.
Seems you take good care of him.
No, that's just common sense.
I don't dislike them.

But I do dislike having animals 
near me when I'm eating or drinking.
So... I'll take my leave.
Don't count on it.

Kim.text: What...?
W-Where am I? Where am I?!
V-Valhalla? Am I dead?

D-Does that mean that Uncle Ingus' 
ramblings about the afterlife looking like 
a shoddy downtown bar are true?
I'm not dead?
...alright, then where the hell am I?

How did I get here?! Who brought me 
here?! What were you planning to do with 
me?!

Are you organ traffickers?! Robbers?! 
Rapists?! Pickpockets?! You're pickpockets, 
aren't you?!
W-W-Why aren't you saying anything?!

You're rapists, aren't you?! RAPISTS! 
THE WHOLE LOT OF YOU!!

You wanna tear my clothes, beat me 
unconscious, have your horrible way with me 
and then brutally murder me, don't you?!

All while still violating every hole in 
my body as I lay there twitching, DON'T 
YOU?!

MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER 
MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER 
MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER MURDER
W-What is that?!
A... Bar?

To "calm down"? What did you spice it 
up with? Roofies? TTX? Pumpkins?

Your stuttering makes you suspicious, 
you know?
Even if you say that...
Hmph...

I'm back. He tried to give me bandages 
at first though.
No...
Says negative.

But you could be in cahoots with the 
clerk in the store. He even knew your name!

Are you implying something won't have 
value because I ignored it?

Are you saying my presence is so 
unimportant that my lack of action will 
yield no difference?!

And what about the drink?! Are you gonna 
let this fruit of your work go to waste so 
easily?!

Well, I'll let you know I'm not that 
unimportant and that your work does matter!
It was good, I guess...
It'll help me calm down a bit, I think.

*cough* Too strong... did you think 
this would calm me down?
Hm...

It was fine, but not something I'd 
order normally.

...yeah. I guess you were telling the 
truth. Sorry about that.

I guess I'll stay for a while; I need 
to get my thoughts in order.
Can you tell me how I got here?
I-I see...

I guess it's better to wake up here than 
on the streets, stripped of clothes, dignity, 
and/or organs.

I guess I'm sick... but I'd rather not 
talk about it.
Why would you do that?
Yeah, you might be right.

Okay then, I'll take you on your offer. 
I'll have a Piano Man.

Yeah, I just gulped the last one, so I 
wanna enjoy this one.
Yeah. This is the one.

My dad used to drink these before an 
actual pianist attempted to kill him.
Wrong place at the wrong time, I guess.

He was relaxing in a bar when suddenly 
the pianist leapt off the stage and started 
punching him.

Some say he was off his meds and that 
my dad looked like some music critic that 
had bashed him.

I still hold my stance that he just got 
too excited. Jazz does that to you.
Oh, that's nice.
Misgendered that Pianist, though...

Don't tell me you're like my mom with 
her politics about what's "for boys" and 
what's "for girls".

That line of thinking led to her buying 
me an erotic cast-off figure when I was, 
like, five.

Basically, a REALLY detailed sort-of PVC 
statue with clothes you can take off.

She bought it thinking "Hey, it's 
just another doll."

...and then justified it by saying 
something like "Well, you'll have to learn 
about your body sooner or later."

...I still wish I had GLO-RI-A-sama's 
body.

This is not a Piano Man... or even a 
Piano Woman. Are you giving me whatever 
you please because it's free?

Well, you're being polite enough, so 
I'll let it pass this time.

So this is how it feels to go for a 
drink at the end of a long hard day at 
work.

I'm not sure if I like the fact that 
I'm falling into that.
Call me Kim.

I don't know if I can say I "work" yet, 
though. I'm still just an intern.

Have you heard of a newspaper called 
"The Augmented Eye"?
...I knew I smelled his nasty cologne.

That bastard leaves his reek wherever 
he goes.
I do.

God, you have no idea how much I hate 
that chauvinistic horseblower.

The worst part is that I kind of admire 
the way he does stuff.

He's so forceful about the things he 
wants that people have it done before they 
realize what's going on.

He even got a pizza delivery boy to 
work server maintenance.

A full week passed before the pizza 
shop asked where the hell he was.

And would you believe it? The guy became 
decent at server maintenance, despite having 
no previous experience.

It's kinda admirable, but at the same 
time I hate his guts! UGH!

Knowing that I have to work for him, 
it's... AGH!

N-No... don't fret about it. I'd rather 
not talk about it, though.
What's your name, bartender?
Is it hard to be a bartender, Jill?

At one point I thought about being a 
bartender...

...but I was afraid they'd make me wear 
skimpy clothes and dance or something.

Your boss sounds like an interesting 
person. What with wanting to put me 
somewhere safe and all that.
...heh.

It was fun to see you break the "wise 
bartender" character you're using here.

It'd be nice to meet this boss of yours 
sometime and thank her.
Oh no, I shouldn't pester her that way.

And besides, it's getting late and I 
don't want to abuse your generosity.

I think I can handle another drink. One 
Brandtini, please.
Yup, this seems like the stuff.
Cheers!

I don't think I can complain about 
this, what with the drink being free 
and all, but...
This isn't my order.
Oh well... cheers!
*ahem* *cough* *ahem*
Yeah, just a bit... *ahem* dizzy.
It... *cough* helps me focus a bit.
...yeah. I'm better now.
Hey Jill, do you work with other women?

You LUCKY bitch. Err... I mean... 
y-you have no idea the heaven you live 
in.

When I started my internship, every 
intern was female.

Have you ever tried competing with women 
for a good spot? They are relentless.

FRIENDS?! Those cunts aren't in it for 
friendship, they're out for BLOOD!
Err... s-sorry, I mean...

The other day I got an assignment, and 
all I got for my efforts was an afternoon 
spent locked in the bathroom.

And this other time? When our 
supervisor praised me? I'm still looking 
for my briefcase.

UGH! Sometimes I just want to take all 
those bitches and throw them in the sewers 
or something.
Let the Lizardmen feast on their livers.

I'm just so tired of having to deal with 
that.
Tired of having to put up with them...
Tired... tired...
Mmm...
Would you be so kind?
Kimberly... La Vallette...
...zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz.
*mumble* Pickpockets... *mumble*

Hey Jill, was this job, like, a lifelong 
dream or something?
Do you regret not fulfilling a dream?

You've never had a dream you wanted 
to chase?
Childish dreams?
OH! Childish dreams, yeah.

I remember I wanted to live in a Koi 
pond when I was seven. The fish seemed to 
be having a blast to me.
So, no dreams?
I see...
Um... who was he?
Oh...

Because now that I think about it, I 
don't really have a dream job or anything 
like that.
Maybe you're right.

Well, I'm gonna take my leave now. 
Thank you for everything.

Please thank your boss on my behalf. 
Bye.
Hello?

I was afraid I'd mix up the 
directions and end up in someone's 
house or something.
I'll have a Sunshine Cloud, please.
Thanks!

This isn't my order... did I arrive 
at a bad time?
Oh, I quit.

Yup! I went to the office of that 
chauvinistic horseblower and told him I 
quit!

*sigh* Well, after I got drunk and 
overslept, I missed some assignments.

My supervisor yelled at me for being 
late. I got the mandatory bullying...

So at some point I just kinda snapped 
and said that I didn't have to put up with 
that.
So I quit.

Oh, don't worry. I should be the one 
apologizing.

Lashing out like that the next day 
and all.

I arrived early to my meeting and got 
some assignment.

I spent hours doing it, only for the 
other bitches to come and ruin it.

After that, I didn't have time left 
so my supervisor scolded me.
So I snapped and quit on a whim.

I guess you'll always have second 
thoughts. Even if you do what you want, 
you'll still think "what if".

Even so, I was getting physically 
sick there. I dreaded the arrival of every 
morning. I even almost...

What I'm saying is: I don't know what 
I'll do, but it's certainly better than 
being there.
I feel... free.

It's a wonderful feeling, you know? I 
feel like now I can find something I care 
about.

I won't return to The Augmented Eye, 
but I could still pursue journalism with 
another outlet.

I haven't felt like this in... 
well... never!
They weren't happy, that's for sure...

My dad took it better, but my mom 
freaked out, to put it mildly.

"What are you gonna do?!" and all 
that.

*sigh* But I'm not here about that. 
Give me a big drink, please.
I don't know... bubbly or something.

If detergent commercials are to be 
believed, this will clean out my insides.

It's big but... ah well, I didn't 
care that much about which drink it was 
anyways.

I didn't particularly care about the 
drink this time around but...
...no, nevermind.

No deep reason. That's what I did 
when I got out of high school.

Taking a year off was out of the 
question so I went for the first thing 
I thought about.

...but I couldn't get into the 
robotics course, so I settled for 
journalism.

...to be honest, I got tired of the 
job midway through it, but I couldn't 
bring myself to leave.

*sigh* Too much pressure from my 
family.
Did you have troubles like those?

Ehhhh... um... g-give me a... err... 
SOMETHING!

S-Sorry. I just have a dry mouth. 
Anything will do.
Thanks.

I feel like I asked something I 
shouldn't have.
Honestly... I don't know.
I do feel liberated, however.

Like... I can do whatever I want. 
Study whatever I like, work wherever I 
want.

I know it's not that way and it won't 
be easy... but I feel a lot more confident 
than when I was out of high school.

I honestly don't get why they put 
young people who barely know how society 
works through that one.

Thanks. I really needed the 
encouragement.
Thanks! Bye Jill.
Jill!

Just call me Kim. It sounds weird to 
be called "Miss".

I got some money on Mega Christmas. 
Wouldn't you be happy?
I'll have a Beer.
Thanks!
This doesn't seem right.
Pretty good, actually!

My hair stopped falling out. My 
appetite is coming back.

I suddenly stopped feeling defeated. 
I actually felt like I achieved a victory!

Like... like I got a hold of my own 
life.

Oh yeah! I'll start bartender 
training in January, too.

Yeah! I did some research and it 
sounded cool.

BTC gives you many benefits, so it 
sounds like a good thing to do for the 
time being.

I don't know if it's what I wanna do 
for the rest of my life, but it's a good 
start.

It'll give me time to think on the 
next course of action.
How do you back down "a bit"?

I thought those apartments were built 
by them or something.
Oh!
Really?
Y-You seem to know a lot about it.
Let's try a Sugar Rush.
Yay!
This isn't... oh whatever.

Actually, Jill, I came here today to 
thank you.

Yeah, back when I first showed up 
here, I was in a really rough spot.

I was shocked. I was tired. I was a 
total mess.

I even said some really mean things, 
but you had patience with me.

Not to mention you helped me cool 
down, and your boss saved me.

And... I don't know, I felt like I 
had to tell you all that before the year 
ended.

But anyway, how are you doing? Last 
time you were a bit... off.

Glad to hear. It was weird to see you 
like that.

It always felt like you were putting 
up a "cool bartender" act.
You don't?
Are you sure?
Huh...

Surprised, actually. What led me to 
believe that you were putting on an act?

And more importantly, how can I make 
use of it when I get assigned to a bar?
I must investigate further.
Say... let's try something bubbly now.
Thanks!
The bubbles are gone...
Boss?
THANK YOU! THANK YOU!!

I'm more than fine! I'm alive! I'm 
here!

I avoided my biggest mistake in life 
thanks to your timely intervention.

I-I don't know what overcame me, I 
just felt like... like... like everything 
was shouting.

I couldn't stop the shouting so I 
just felt like...
Like...
THANK YOU!
Don't worry. I'm perfectly fine.

I've gone to a therapist a couple of 
times, but he says I'm okay.

I just... something overcame me, but you 
intervened and...
I... I don't know what to say.

*sniff* I should've come to thank you 
earlier. I owed you that at least.
I will!

I'll be leaving. Happy New Year, 
Jill! And thank you again.
YOUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU!!

Because of you I got up late and lost 
a full day of work! And on the day everyone 
got a nifty assignment too!

You were the one that got me drunk and 
made me fall asleep like a goddamn log!
T-That's all you have to say?!
B-But...!
I... AGH!

Seriously, what kind of answer is 
THAT?!
Ugh... Hello Mr. Donovan.

Rad Shiba.text:
Hey! Be more respectful! I 
brought my boss here.

You're talking to the great 
Nacho Tumbleweed Jr.!

No, that's not Dana. That's 
just J.
I'm fine. What about you, boss?

Can't they just share the ones 
we have?

But many have enjoyed the boxes 
more than they do the balls!

Ooooooh, as expected from you, 
boss.

Wait, what if they come with 
foil?

Russenstrauss had to be taken 
to the vet because he ate the foil a piece
