I know. Her smile is so cute 
too.

So it's better that we vet for 
a vet?

Your boss sure is nice. Glad 
I'm working with her too.

Actually, I'm just gonna go sit 
over there and be on standby. Await orders.

Are those things on your head 
your ears?

Hey! If I bark, then I'm the 
king of the bar! 'cause I'm barking!

Okay... why are your nails so 
thin?

Your nails! You won't be able 
to dig with such flimsy nails!

Yes! Come on! Pet me harder! Is 
that all you've got?!

Alright! You, the blonde. Pet 
me.

I dare you to call me a good 
boy!
Hey J, I dare you to bury me.

I was joking! Joking! Don't 
bury me for reals! I'm alive!

It might be Tom, it might be 
James, it might be something else. But I'm 
not revealing it!

What I CAN tell you is that my 
name is-...
Okay then, who's YOUR owner, G?

I'm in charge and I want you to 
pet me.

You'll pet me sooner or later. 
They all do.

Do you need me to psyche you up 
then?

People actually pay for this 
shit?
Alcohol isn't so bad after all!

I'm here to help the funding of 
my organization.

What? No! Don't lump me with 
those Herding Supremacists.

I have a more noble and benign 
organization. I belong to CIRA.

We give a place where dogs can be 
dogs and save them from themselves.

CIRA is what I love, but, damn is 
it expensive sometimes.

We decided to take part-time jobs 
to help fund anything it needs.

We want to help CIRA be the best 
it can be.

Pay treatment for hurt dogs, give 
food to the hungry ones, play with the 
bored ones...
Say, do you have a menu?

Oh, the Grizzly Temple is one of 
those.

Fluffy Dream? I like the sound 
of this one.

Hey! This doesn't look like the 
glass in the menu.

I didn't need that many weird 
skills to be part of this so it was my best 
bet.

Besides, it's close to home, so I 
can get here by walking.

And I do love me some walks. 
I could walk all day!

Yeah, stuff like "food 
handler's certificate", "previous work 
experience", or "thumbs".
Why did you pick a bar?

Oh yeah. About the way you mix 
stuff.
Hello cat! Wanna play? Let's play!

We don't hate them - unless they're 
intruders.

You said his name was Fore? Hello 
Fore! Let's play!

Yeah, but I'll talk with 
John-face here for a bit.

Oh! A customer. Sorry for the 
intrusion.
G and J! How are you doing?

'sup little girl? What are 
you doing in a bar?

Nacho.text:
I wanted to see the place my best 
soldier is working at.
Oh! It's you, Dana!

Soldier, why didn't you tell me you 
were working for Dana?
Part of it? I FOUNDED it!

Humans have the best intentions, 
but they just don't get us.

So I decided to create a place 
where dogs can be dogs.

"Here, we can take in any dog 
without a place in this world."
We created our own heaven on earth.

Do I look like one of those Seifar 
bitches? Of course not!

I'd include other animals, but 
sadly I can only take care of those who 
are of the same species as I.
Manly stuff.
Did I stutter?
Yes! This is just what I wanted.

BLEGH! This tastes worse than my 
own butt.
This looks good.

BLEGH! This tastes worse than cat 
poo.
Are you underestimating me, kid?

I'll let you know I was the top 
graduate from my paw to hand combat 
class.

Yes! I was the only one to follow 
MMAJunkie2040's video tutorials to the 
end.

This is a really nice place, you 
know?

You picked a good place to work at, 
soldier.

Your efforts to keep CIRA afloat 
will not go to waste! We'll make her 
better and better!

We have more urgent matters at hand 
though. Like the fact we don't have enough 
balls for everyone!

You fool! Every dog has a right to 
have his own ball!

If we can't provide even that, then 
what's the point of even trying?!
That's a good point.

What do you think is cheaper, a box 
of balls or a box of boxes?

Of course there are! How do you 
think they ship boxes?
Tied together? Don't be silly.

This world is filled with all sort 
of recursive madness, you know?

Doctors consult doctors, boxes come 
in boxes, bottles come in bottles.

So tomorrow you're gonna check for 
people selling boxes, you hear?

Curses! You're right. We need a 
contingency plan.

I wonder if we can strike a deal 
with the vet those Seifar bastards have.
She's always so nice with us.
Yes, put that on the list.

I was just passing by, I've got 
some errands to run.
Alright, greenhorn! Let's get going!
Soldier! You're late!
Games are for kids!

Betty.text: Man, I sure need to get wasted.

For fuck's sake, you piece of 
scrap, we just got out of a building full 
of dogs.
*sigh*
Hey Jill.
Get me a Beer, will you?
He's fine.

Friday-after-work isn't just a Beer 
though. It's THE Beer.
Yeah!
Cheers!

And thus, this Friday becomes 
better already.
This ain't no Beer.

But I'll have it anyways. I'm not 
gonna let you ruin my Friday.
Say, are you okay Jill?

You look down, or at least lost in 
thought.

I mean, it's not like you're a 
really expressive girl, but you don't have 
that... um... sharp look.
If you say so...

That's still no excuse for messing 
my drink though.

You usually look more attentive. 
But you are looking a bit lost now.
It's hard to put into words.
Hey Jill, do you like Beer?

I had this friend back in high 
school who made some pretty nice crafts 
with them.

I'm still in contact with him if 
you're interested.

Well, that Laura girl is stirring 
things up, for better or for worse.
She's... um... like a rabbit.

An overtly politically-correct 
rabbit.

Never had a pet rabbit? They're a 
nervous mess that gets startled over the 
littlest of things.

And this girl is on the constant 
lookout, scared of saying something that 
might irk someone.

It doesn't have to be the person 
she's speaking with, even.

It's no problem in the company, but 
the other day, we went out together and 
holy shit!
Poor girl can't speak properly.

She pauses every sentence to make 
sure she doesn't say something offensive.

She's a nice girl, and it's sweet 
that she tries so hard to not offend 
anyone.

...but seriously, she tries too 
hard.
Yeah, well...

It's just that... she looks so cute 
when she's startled.
Like a rabbit.
Well, why don't we test that?
You go out with her.

To test if it's really me who makes 
her like that.

It's not like you can say no, you 
know?

I mean, it's my honor that's on the 
line here.

I wanna prove you're only talking 
shit about me.

I got drunk. Aaaaaaand that's all I 
remember after that.

I-I did? Damn, I need to keep my 
mouth shut when drunk.

Well, It's not like I'm trying to 
do that. You know?
She's fun.

She actually reacts when I tease 
her.

You take it in your stride, but she 
actually gets startled, squirms and then 
gets uncomfortable!

She's cute and her reactions are 
cute.
Shit. You're right.

I must save my teasing for when 
the moment is just right, then.
It is for me.

And what are you doing here? What 
about the dog?

I wouldn't know. We get along as 
co-workers at the very least.
Slow.

She's the kind that does things so 
carefully that she does them really, 
really slowly.
Really, REALLY slowly.

I can't deny that when she actually 
finishes stuff, she does a great job, but...
It's unnerving.
Because she likes dogs.

And that's why I insist that you 
two would make a fine couple.

Yo, piece o' scrap, she's totally 
calling you a pussy.

But then, you'd be underestimating 
the power of LOOOOOOOOOVE.

Whether you want to admit it or 
not, love changes people for better or for 
worse.

Who knows? Maybe you'll become more 
assertive after spending time with her.
I guess that's a possibility too.

Because she's like a cute rabbit... 
so someone might try to eat her out there.

It'd be a lot easier to keep her in 
my sight.

You make me sound like some 
skirt-chaser.
...she's not into girls.
I asked her directly.

She seemed... um... giddy 
afterwards though.

I heard her muttering something 
about meeting her first lesbian...
It was weird.
That-...
...party pooper.
Let's get a drink then.
Get me a Fringe Weaver.

So it's not called that 
because it glows in the dark?

First, she calls you a pussy, and 
now she messes up your drink?
If I were you, I'd be mad.

No, wait. If I were you, I'd do 
nothing and let it slide.
That meat was raw and you know it!
Your point being?

I don't mind if you're apologizing 
for calling him a pussy, you've still 
messed up my drink.

Then that'd mean she's holding a 
grudge against me instead!

My god, that stoic look of yours 
almost got my guard down.
Why two of these?
That's bullshit, but I believe it.
*sigh* Not a single drink right.

Come to think of it. Did you ever 
change because of a relationship, Jill?

Would you say for better or for 
worse?

So you were one of those kinds of 
people.

As for me, sometimes I think I 
became more... err... what's the word?
Hey...

*sigh* But yeah. I think I became 
all that because of this one girlfriend I 
had in college.

She got me into the whole activism 
thing in the first place.

We'd all go and protest. We'd start 
all kinds of movements to see things 
changed...
I really got into the whole thing.

But whenever I wanted to get more 
serious, I'd find myself coming up against 
a wall.

That wall is an analogy for the 
fact that not everyone was willing to 
go that far.

I found out pretty fast that most 
of them were in the whole thing because of 
some shitty fad.

And not because they actually believed 
in whatever movement they were championing.

So I moved from group to group, only 
to find people who were in it because of a 
fad.

And when they were not in it because 
of a passing fad, they were of the dangerous 
extremist kind.

My tolerance for people's shit was 
greatly diminished after all that.
Uh...
Whatever!

So, how did you spend last 
Saturday, Jill?

If you ask me, the whole thing had 
to happen.

Given all the gunshots and madness 
going on, the White Knights had to show 
their true faces sooner or later.

Of course I'm angry all of that 
happened. A friend's boyfriend died in one 
of those riots.

But in the end, they showed people 
outside of the city that there's a lot of 
corruption and chaos taking place here.

Having neighboring cities intervene 
in the riots is evidence enough that they 
realized the magnitude of the problem.

Many know about it. They just say 
"Man, that's horrible" and move on.

Then again, net activism can only 
get you so far with this kind of stuff.

It's not like a bunch of people 
expressing their concerns online will do 
that much of a difference.

But if they at least get to know 
how bad things are around here, instead of 
just knowing they're 'bad'...
How so?

See, piece o' junk? She understands 
how to get her idea through to me.
Where's the other guy, by the way?
Figures.
Why didn't he do it then?

The pay from the dogs isn't enough 
to keep up with the mounting debts. I 
don't know how you do it.
Well...
Fiiiiiiiiiine.
Let's go then.
See ya, Jill.
Man, you're such a party pooper.
I was right.

That Laura girl was head over heels 
for him! I was right on the money!

Isn't she the one that passed out 
last time?
Anyways...

Betty was right and that deserves a 
Beer!
Alright!
WOO!!
You're not killing my mood, Jill!

You should've seen her, screaming 
from the top of her lungs that she liked 
him.

And him just standing there 
thinking.
Just like that!

In retrospect, it was a tad too 
cliched for my taste. *BRRRRRRR*
Still, I KNEW she liked him.
I was right! I was right!
He never is.

...unlike your co-worker. Holy 
shit, did he fuck?

That beaming face is unmistakable. 
The face of a guy that got some and 
enjoyed every moment.

Victories like these are few and 
far between. Let me enjoy myself.

That's not how you drown your 
sorrows, piece o' scrap.
I'll have a Bloom Light.
Same.

Man, aren't you the lucky bastard 
today.
WOOO! I win again!
You're not gonna get me down!
Well, for starters...
Her?
What do you think, Jill?

I mean about piece o' scrap's 
situation.
...and thank you.

Eh, these things are humans in all 
but organs nowadays anyways.

Why wouldn't she? This fella is a 
good catch, if I do say so myself.

And like I said: Humans in all but 
organs.

You've surely encountered Lilim 
that you sometimes forget are not humans.

We live in weird times but hey, 
that only makes them more interesting.

It's odd going to other cities and 
not seeing the same integration of Lilim 
though.

Let's commemorate the occasion with 
a Piano Man and a Piano Woman!
And now we reach a stalemate.

I'd normally take the Piano Man, 
but I feel there's a symbolic value in 
taking the woman.
Hm...
Okay then. You take the man.

Well neith-.. ah, fuck symbolism, 
gimme that.
Alright then. You take the woman.

This drink might be the only kind 
of woman I don't like.
Aaaand wrong.
*sniff*
I hate Laura.
She's gonna take you away from me!

You're my piece o' scrap, not hers! 
You're mine! Miiiiine!
Heheh...
You're right.
So you won't leave me?
We'll come!
We WILL.
Bye Bill.
Well, we better leave for now.
Hm?
Sure.
See ya then. Bye!
I insist that it sounds like dynamite.
You're a heavy-duty tool.
Wait, that... dammit!

I could've sworn this place looked 
a lot more... pink the last time we came. 
Maybe it's the lighting.

Hey, bartender. What did that noise 
just now sound like to you?

Well, we aren't here to discuss that. 
We're here to...
Um... who is he?

I don't know, you have more of a 
John face.
Where was he last weekend?
Beer.

Man, after-work Beer is always the 
best Beer.

I'll take care of anything you don't 
drink, don't worry.
Oh, I see.

You want to see us fight for the Beer, 
don't you?

Well, I'll have you know that I can 
leave this guy begging for mercy.
Flawless victory.
Aaaand, we're off to a good start.

We're not the dogs, Bartender. You 
can drop your guard.
So tell me, bartender...
Jill? That's a nice name.
How's business lately?

I guess when we came here with all 
the dogs, it was quite the change of pace, 
huh?
6k people?

That sounds familiar... I think one 
of the dogs talked about seeing someone 
doing that.
I don't know if it's the same person.

So, there will be a lot more witnesses 
if something's said?

Just a minor charge of petty 
vandalism.

Painted graffiti outside of my high 
school saying "Ms. Thompson's a cunt".
Because Ms. Thompson was a cunt!

She constantly humiliated whoever got 
her questions wrong.

She also constantly bullied two of 
my classmates!

True, I got a week of suspension and 
had to clean the wall.

But it gave everyone the courage to 
speak up!

It's Friday. A drink to kick off the 
weekend is one of those little things that 
makes life worthwhile.

But he did only suggest it after I 
found him hugging a stuffed Corgi in his 
office.

It's not hard, considering the rest of 
the staff don't use chairs or tables. Even 
I have my own office.
What about a kennel?
Oh, I gave it to him.
It was my gift last Mega Christmas.

That's the funniest part. He acted 
like I didn't know he had it.

I was just glad he was enjoying it, 
you know?

Because you're not giving any input 
anyway.

It's that textile company where the 
owner believes herself to be an alpaca.
Oh...

Those designs were embarrassing, you 
know?

But something tells me that's why 
they were approved.
You're such a wuss...
I'll have a Zen Star, please.
Thank you.
Oh... kay then...
I'll take it.

You don't expect me to pay for this, 
do you?
I'll have whatever this guy orders.

You have such a... wimpy taste in 
drinks, Deal.

You missed nothing. Sometimes I wish I 
could go back in time and kick myself.

Because I said I'd have whatever you 
ordered and that's what I got.

Whatever. I'm still grabbing this 
one.

...you need more of a spine or you 
won't find a worthy woman.

Next time I'm really grabbing your 
drink.

You know, I COULD storm off right now 
and it'd be entirely within my rights to do 
so.
But... I'll pass this time.
But you aren't.

Seriously, though, you need to stop 
being so... passive and quiet.

You're only assertive when dogs are 
involved.

If you were at a restaurant and the 
waiter took a bite out of your order...

...would you just sit quietly because 
no dogs were involved?

I've seen you stand quietly as 
someone else takes your spot in line, you 
know?
They disrespect you.

Do you have any idea how much that 
attitude annoys me?!

But who am I kidding, if you were a 
girl, I'd find that attitude adorable and 
be all over you.
Hm...

That girl that's designing the 
clothes...

She's cute, but she should take more 
care in her appearance.

I mean, right now she fits the 
"unkempt cutie" category so well that 
it's almost painful.

It's so cliched that I can't help but 
cringe when looking at her.

It's like when you see something 
that's such a cheesy movie cliche...

...you just feel the need to kick 
whatever the hell it is.

I wasn't gonna kick her. Why'd you 
think I'd kick her?
Fine. Guilty as charged.

Still, I'm gonna do something about 
her. I feel like I just need to.
It's a matter of honor.

Well, maybe honor isn't the right 
word.

But she has potential and I'm not 
going to let her waste it.
She's your boss, right?

Nope, I'm just the veterinarian. The 
dogs were the ones that organized a meeting 
with her.

I'd say she's really good looking. 
But honestly, those pants rob her of her 
charm.

They make her look too uptight... and 
at a glance, she doesn't seem like the type.

Some shorts or a skirt would fit her 
better.

Amazing, you actually made that sound 
weird as hell.

Yes, I have the habit of trying to 
guess someone's behaviour based on their 
looks.

No, it's not a hobby. You made that 
sound like I'm some sort of creep.

Nothing much, really. Mostly that you 
were too polite.

Not a natural polite, though. More 
like a professional polite. You're like 
that because you need to be.
That was it, really.

Although the way you looked at me when 
I said your boss could use a skirt or shorts 
was interesting.

You seemed... interested in what I 
said. Like you'd like to see that scenario.
Hm...
Hmhm...

He's either a total simpleton or acts 
like one in a way that consumes the rest of 
his character.
But anyway, I'm just a veterinarian.

My judgement might be clouded by 
seeing so many furry businessmen.
Let's have another round.

You'll have something strong. You 
need to pump some testosterone into your taste 
in drinks.
You'll thank me later. Trust me.

Two strong drinks. Manly drinks. I 
don't care which ones.
You shut up.
Now, drink.
Oh, man up. You'll get used to it.

No, you get this one and I'll have 
the softer one.

You're not helping me, Jill. It's 
better he learns how to drink like a man 
now rather than later.

Hey, you piece o' scrap. There's 
something I need to tell you.

You can listen too, Phil. I know 
curiosity kills you.
Okay, here we go...

That girl, Laura? She's head over 
heels for you!

She's the one that's designing the 
dog clothes.

Just "huh"? That's all you've got to 
say?
Yes!
Damn it!

Anyway. It's fucking obvious she's 
all over you, you know?

The way she steals glimpses of you... 
how she looks around for you whenever she 
enters a room...
Oh man, youth is awesome.

Shut up, Will. *yawn* It's love and I 
know it.

Three of the dogs thought it was a 
good idea to eat plastic foil...
One had a paw stuck in a jar...
They're like kids sometimes.
Thank you...
Yesh mom...

Hey Jill, has someone ever proposed 
to you as a prank?

You know, make you think they're 
falling in love with you just to reveal 
that it was all a prank.
Jill?
Ouch...
Sorry, I-...
...hey, piece o' scrap.

These are the situations where 
you should've stopped me before I said 
anything.
U-Um...

I was asking because one of my exes' 
cousins has been hitting on me the past 
couple of days.

If it were somebody else, I'd pretend 
to be straight with the help of this piece 
o' scrap here.
Sadly, she knows who I am.

Worst part is, knowing Vero, she 
probably put her cousin up to it as a 
practical joke.
It's better than my suggestion.

The Girl Scouts also taught me how to 
skin a deer, and I see nobody making a fuss 
about that.

But yeah, your advice sounds good 
enough.

Especially when you factor that if 
Gina's being honest about her, she probably 
won't feel offended.

Blonde, flat as a cutting board but 
cute as a button.
That's the one.

Well, it's getting late. We should be 
going.
Bye.

Deal.text:
I fail to see how getting wasted 
will make you feel bett-... 
SHIBAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!

But this one has a Hawaiian shirt! 
And sunglasses!
And he talks!
Okay... roll!
So cute...
You don't help either.

You randomly yell "WHAT DID YOU 
SAY?!" whenever she's within earshot 
distance.

It raises up the question of 
whether she's really like that...

...or if you're the one making her 
wary of anything she says.
How?
Why?

Do you, by any chance, remember what 
happened last time we came here?

You were rambling about her being 
head over heels for me or something like 
that.
...right.

Even if you were right, you have... 
quite the fixation on that girl.
Fun how?
How is that any good?

But if you keep it up, she'll 
either leave or get used to you.
You know... like me.
No, that's not the problem.
He said he had to go out...
By the way, he said his name was-...

She doesn't actually have to be with 
us in the building though. She's more like 
a freelancer.

That's a really superficial 
statement. It's like saying you'd be fine 
with someone because you're both women.
Okay... bad example.
By all means.
She's right though.

Sharing interests and being 
compatible are totally different things.
Or she'll drive me nuts.

Still, why are you so insistent on 
me and her getting together?

So in short, your motherly instincts 
arose because of Laura.

*sigh* Why not see if she likes you 
and-...

...you already tried to hit on her, 
didn't you?
How did you find out?
Of course you did.
Okay... enough Laura for a night.

Refrain from using any "That's what 
you said last night" jokes or variations 
thereof. Please.
Sounds good.
I'll have a Bloom Light, please.
I wonder why it's called a Bloom Light.

It's better than getting thrown out 
of a restaurant because you insulted the 
head chef.
It was Venison Tartare.

She might not be apologizing to me, 
you know?

Cynical? Jaded? Bitter? Tired of the 
crap this world and everyone in it throws 
on a daily basis?
I'm just quoting you.
How is that bad?

You seriously never thought about it 
that way?

You need to stop putting the blame 
for what you do on past relationships.

We arrived at work on Monday only to 
find all the dogs hiding behind the desks.

Some were trying to open a hole in 
the floor, so the carpet's ruined.

They have food, water and a 
bathroom. Not to mention advanced security 
measures.

Their owners probably thought it'd 
be safer for them to stay there.

Yeah, but think of all the people 
that died because of that.

Not only here, but in the Apollo 
Trust Bank too.

Aren't you seeing that with a harsh 
sort of "to each their own" mentality?

Many people leave the city, but not 
of their own volition.

They do it because they have a 
better opportunity outside. But they still 
have families here.

Many have visited the city in better 
times, and it hurts them to see it like 
this.

Problem is that written words usually 
fail to convey the emotion needed...

But I bet many of them would do what 
they can.
Yeah!

Oh, yeah. The one that was here 
asked if you were "the nice vet lady that 
works at the Seifar Toy Company."

I suppose he's interested in talking 
to you or something.
I don't know.

You've been doing a few jobs on the 
side, haven't you?

We're fine, but we have to get up 
early tomorrow. And by "we," I really mean 
her.

She got invited to a picnic and I 
won't stand to hear another "had to go to 
a picnic with a hangover" story.
Bye.

You'll be the party pooper tomorrow 
if you keep drinking.
Um, say... that girl...
Sorry!
I'm fine.

*sigh* Can I get something 
non-alcoholic here?
Thanks.

Celebrate all you want, but I'm 
freaking out here.

I know nothing about relationships! 
I have no idea what to do!
What do you think, Jill?

Betty, I've seen a few of your 
relationships. Remember?

Aside from Veronica, there's Angela, 
Pamela, Sandra, Rita, Monica, Erica, Tina, 
Mary, and Jessica.
Or should I say...

"Didn't share the bed sheets," 
"Snores like a pig," "Cold feet," "Shampoo 
waster," "Chocolate addict"...

"Too religious," "Fan of the wrong 
rugby team," "Teetotaler," and "Chews 
with the mouth open"?

I... don't know. I don't know her 
that well.
What?
Yeah, I think I'll try that.
Why order like that then?
I don't want to.
I expected a witty comment.
You what?
Betty... You don't own me.

Besides, I can't, for the life of 
me, leave you alone.

I feel like the moment I let you out 
of my sight, you'll just... crash.

That's not a laughing matter. You 
need someone making sure you aren't 
kicking people.
That's not normal, you know?

Besides, it's not like I have 
something with her yet.

*sigh* I'd worry myself sick if I left 
you to your own devices, honestly.
We should leave now.
Are you sure?
Fine. We'll be here, Jill.
Anyway, see ya then.
I'm in.
Good night, Jill.

No, it was too long to be dynamite. It 
sounded more like some heavy-duty tool.
Yes, I am.

I say it sounds like construction, but 
Betty here says it's dynamite or something 
like that.
Eh? Do you think it's dynamite then?

Oh, what the hell. I'll have a Beer 
too.
Thank you.
Thanks, but this might be too much.
Oklahoma! Take the Beer.
It's my safeword.
Um... I have a question, Jill.
Do you regularly let people sleep here?

So, six thousand people are watching 
and hearing us?
I see.
Nope.
I suggested coming here after work.
A plushie. Not an overfed dog.
Yeah, what's weird about that?
A kennel...
A kennel...

I don't know, I just thought it'd be 
cute if one day I went to work and they 
had one waiting for me..
Like they saw me as one of them.

Why are you two talking like I'm not 
here?

Well, we recently struck a deal with 
Farmer Fabrics to start a doggie clothing 
line.

We hired a new employee and she showed 
the higher ups some designs.

After a couple of talks, they decided 
to give the clothing production a try.
I'm still handling this Beer, so I'm fine.
Let's see... I'll have a Brandtini.

Not all of us spent their weekends in 
college partying like maniacs.

Actually, not all of us went to 
college.
Hey! Why are you taking the Brandtini?

That... doesn't make a whole lot of 
sense.
Fine...
O-Oh...
Shouldn't I be the outraged one?
That's true.
But I like dogs.
Um...

Yeah. Last time that happened, you got 
too involved and left the poor guy a crying 
mess.

The same way you don't get how I can be 
so passive, I don't understand why you need 
to be so hot-headed.

Seems like it's too much effort for 
stuff that, honestly, I just don't feel is 
worth the energy.

Trust me, I'll act when I feel they've 
crossed a line. Until then I'd rather not 
stir up a mess.
That's... quite the double standard...
Something on your mind?
Laura? What about her?
Cringe?
K-Kick?

Betty, I didn't think I'd have to say 
this to you twice in the same month but... 
you shouldn't kick people.

Because I've seen you kick people 
before.

Apparently unprovoked or due to 
complicated reasons only you understand.
Honor, she says...
Now that I think about it...

You have that hobby of speculating 
what someone's personality is like based 
just on their looks.

I mean, you did the same with Jill 
here.
I-I did?
Sounds like a good idea. I'll have...
Well...
Nf...
Okay, then...
*sigh*
Phew...
Hm?
Huh...

What? Do you want me to blush and act 
flustered and shy?

Just the non-heavy duty Social 
Development types... and I'm of the heavy 
duty kind.
Are you tired?

Sleep a bit. I'll wake you up when we 
leave.

Exhaustion and alcohol. What can I 
say?
I'm still fine, yeah.
Sure.
That's a tough one...

First, there's the whole problem of 
workplace romances.

I also don't know her very well. In 
fact, I'd be lying if I said I remember 
what her face looks like.

Well, if I rejected her, that would 
hurt her, don't you think?
How do you handle that?
Tough question?
Yeah, you're right.

Nah, she'll forget everything in the 
morning.

Speaking of which, we should be 
going.
Goodbye.
Betty, wake up. We're leaving.
Yeah?

It's better to learn by tripping 
yourself.
Waterboarding.

The fact that she knows how to 
waterboard somebody is what scares me 
most.
Gina... Which one was that again?

Oh yeah... she came to the office 
Christmas party, right?
Yeah.
Thank you again for everything, Jill.

Vella.text: Wait here. I'll check inside.
Oh, a BTC bar.

Excuse me. Do you know where the 
Athena Convention Center is?
Thanks.
Thanks a lot.

Hm... eh, what the hell. I'll have a 
drink.
What about you?
A Brandtini, please.
Thanks.
Something's not right here...

Essentia.text:
...short hair, black sailor 
uniform, missing an arm.

Vella.text:
Well, I'm actually cosplaying 
so... call me Vella for the time being.

Have you heard of a game called 
YIIK, bartender?

That one. We're in a cosplay 
group dedicated to it and we got lost on 
the way.

Oh, yeah. A friend is cosplaying 
as Alex. I told him to wait outside.
He'll be fine.

Now, now. Don't spook the 
bartender.

I'll get a Fluffy Dream and be on 
my way.
Yup, this is the thing.
*sigh* Whatever.

Damn, I got dizzy pretty fast. I 
better stop here.

...now that I think about it. 
Just who are you, um... Essentia?
I guess? I don't know.

I just kinda met her in a 
convention and she stuck with me ever 
since.

She also seems off. Like she's 
missing something or thinking too much.

Well, I won't hold you any 
longer. We should go.
Goodbye.
Why the hell are you on the floor?
Tased? By the vending machines?

He'll be fine. He started 
chatting with one of the vending machines.
They were talking about R&B music.
1980's I think.
Um...
Oh god.

Right. Thanks again for the 
directions.

Art.text: Ah. Hey there, girl.
Give me a strong drink, won't you?
Yes, this'll do.

Not strong enough, kid. I ain't 
paying for this.

Nothing special. I was just working 
on a case and I happened to be in the area.
Tracking someone... a gun-for-hire.
I am tracking that girl.

I did, but the guy offered a huge 
amount of money and... well... I just 
couldn't refuse again.
Hm...
Say, how safe is this place?

Okay, then... wait. Soundproof walls? 
Why?
Alright then.
Have you heard of Lord Lance Lavender?

He's some big name from Kanyevania. 
His blood apparently has some weird 
reaction to Glitch City's nanomachines.

Once in contact with the air, it 
does nothing.

But if still fresh and touching 
someone's blood, the nanomachines will 
initiate a reaction.

Essentially, they'll just eat through 
the other person's body until there's 
nothing left.

They're using him as a guinea pig to see 
what causes that reaction and if it could 
be used to fight Nanomachine Rejection.

Well... turns out the Crimson Rose is 
his daughter.

She left years ago to earn her living 
here and he hasn't seen her ever since.

Doubt it. I did my research. She 
really is his daughter.

I had no clue who was making the 
contract, and tracking all the messages to 
the source would've been too costly.

Knowing who the sender was made 
things easier.
Hm... what about a Cobalt Velvet?
Oh... you actually did it.
N-No...
HA! Wrong drink!
Don't be. Free drink!

He told me he wanted to see her again 
one last time or, at the very least, 
deliver her a message.
Yes, people lie. You made your point.

Even then, I felt like I couldn't say 
no.

I mean, I know what it's like not 
being able to find your daughter...

What it's like to be apart from her, 
not knowing what she's doing or even if 
she's alright.

I have a daughter. She's about your 
age.

When she was a teen, we had a big 
fight and she ran away from home.

At first, I just waited for her to 
show up. But then I started getting 
worried and went out to find her.

I couldn't find any trace of her. 
Nobody had seen her. Soon, I was worried 
if something might've happened to her.

I guess that's how my tracking skills 
and list of contacts began to grow.

I finally found her, taking cover in 
some dumpster, unconscious from starvation.

So yeah, I just couldn't say no to 
his request of finding his daughter.
But I don't expect you to understand.

I'm very close to finding her... that 
girl's pretty good at covering her tracks.

Compared to the her from before the 
bank incident, though, she seems slower, 
somehow.

Either she's let her guard down or 
something else is happening.

I have this letter I'm supposed to 
deliver to her.

I don't know what it says and I don't 
want to find out.

I might not look like it, but I can 
take care of myself, bartender.

You don't stay so long in this 
business without picking up a couple of 
tricks.

Okay, I better go back to work before 
her trail goes cold.
Gut Punch.
Oh, you got it right.
Alright! Free drink!
A bit of holiday blues, you could say.
Why wouldn't I?
Why does everyone keep saying that?!
If you have something to say, say it.
A season of consumerist craze.

Mega Christmas is just a mockery of 
what the real Christmas once was.

I mean, the season has slowly become 
enslaved to the corporations over time.

"Holiday spirit" can only be 
manipulated so much.

But then came that Turbo Male guy. He 
started a yearly tradition of dressing up 
like Santa in the ring.
It is.

His partner was Buster Master and his 
rival was Dr. Chris Max. Tacky names were 
not a problem.

And then every company jumped on the 
bandwagon and Christmas was Mega Christmas 
before anyone noticed.
Yup.
The holiday IS a joke.
*sigh* No, I don't.

Do you know what kind of people 
celebrate Festivus?

The kind that's so lame and bland 
that they can only talk about how they're 
better because they celebrate Festivus.

Like those jerks who only eat Nuke 
and think they're better than everyone 
else.
Get me a Fringe Weaver, will you?
Right, thanks.
Hah! Thanks a lot.

Why so interested? Are you hitting on 
me?

You'd be surprised by the amount of 
girls that are into older men.
Whatever, I'm married, anyway.

So you wanna know why I'm feeling 
down?
Nah, there's no problem.

Well, you see. I found the girl I was 
looking for...
...in her last moments.

I followed her tracks and finally 
found her. Although to be fair, it's more 
like she stopped trying to cover them.

She was just sitting in a room near 
some more corpses. From what I gathered 
later, seems it was some drug lab.

She passed herself off as a 
prostitute, and then proceeded to 
kill everyone inside.

When I found her, she was drugged to 
hell and back.

According to what little I could get 
out of her, she was dying.

Seems the same rejection she used to 
kill her targets was also killing her too.

As a psycho-for-hire, you'd think 
she'd have had the foresight to think 
about that before coming into the city.

But anyway, I had a job to do, so I 
delivered her letter.

...only for her to tear it apart 
without reading it.

I thought something like that might 
happen.

To be honest, at that point, I was 
really just doing it for my own sense of 
peace.

Apparently, the guy wasn't exactly 
the best father out there.

She was born for experimental 
purposes. A living guinea pig for her 
father's condition.

He was literally going to use her to 
test any treatment, no matter how 
unorthodox.

She was experimented upon from an 
early age. And when she found out what her 
blood was capable of, she just... snapped.

In her own words, "I didn't have to 
take shit from anyone anymore, not even my 
'father'".

So she ran away, came to the city. 
Became a gun for hire...

Got trapped in that bank. Then, the 
rejection started to kick in...

It hit me hard, you know? I kinda saw 
my own daughter in her at that moment.

The anger she bore against this old 
man...

I've seen it before. Many times while 
my daughter was a teen.

She... my daughter was born as a boy. 
And back then, spent all her time angry.

I had a short fuse, so I lost control 
with her more often than not.
I yelled at her, she yelled at me...

When she turned 11, she started her 
transition process. Her behaviour changed 
a lot.

She was calmer, friendlier... but my 
relationship with her was already 
fractured.

It wasn't until a couple of years ago 
that she decided to give me a second 
chance.

I've been doing my best to make 
amends, but I still remember the anger on 
her face.

And to see that girl, in her death 
throes, with that same look...
Huh?

Yeah, I'll do that. Thanks for 
everything, bartender.
Shouldn't I be asking that?
There's nothing new, really.

The lynchings of White Knights 
stopped, so there's that.

Something about the armor. I haven't 
gotten much on that one yet.

All in all, the madness following the 
attack on the bank seems to have settled 
down a bit.

All records of whatever happened 
there have been long deleted.

Security cams, system logs... 
everything was wiped.

Whatever happened there, it's become 
even more of a mystery now.
Hey, bartender. You okay?
There's not much to say, really.

There's the odd silly rumor here and 
there.

Like the vending machines' tasers 
malfunctioning and applying more strength.

Or that the writer of The Last Rain 
In The World is actually living here as a 
brain in a jar.

But those are the kind of rumors you 
hear from crackheads.

Crackheads might hold that one last 
piece of info you need, but you also hear 
crap like that.

Anyway, I'm leaving. Happy New Year, 
bartender.

Hello, I'm looking for some 
information...

What can you tell me about a girl 
nicknamed "Crimson Rose"?
Do you know anything about her?

I have $80 here that might refresh your 
memory.
Really?!
Nothing at all?

Man, you're a sucky bartender. Not 
having any info I need.
Well, I...
Yeah, well...
Why are you scolding me?

Wait... of course! You want all deals 
to be clean, so you need me to spend money 
on the bar.

That's how it works, right? I spend 
money. You give me the info.

Okay then, get me a drink, but keep it 
under $80.
Now THIS makes you a sucky bartender.
Nonononononono, don't.

In fact, I'll just forget the info 
thing.

Okay then. Do you know anything about 
the girl?
But you said...
So -- I need to spend more?
Can I at least get my money back?
*sigh* I guess.
Von Delay, Art Von Delay.

I'm a private detective. It's what I 
do.

You're assuming the girl I'm looking 
for is innocent, or lost.

She's half of the so-called "Reapers" 
of the city.

Two guns-for-hire that work for 
whoever's resourceful enough to find 
them and wealthy enough to pay them.

Crimson Rose and Cobalt Lily, they 
call themselves.

I don't know. I got the letter with the 
instructions and a paycheck.

I have the money, so what do I care if 
it is?

Besides, considering the amount I was 
able to cash in with that check, it'd be a 
pretty wasteful prank.

Still, any information or rumors you 
could give me?

They don't have to be related to the 
girl.

It's always good to keep up with local 
goings-ons.

Dammit! What kind of bar is this if you 
can't gather the word on the street?

Do you know something that might help 
me, Gil?
He knows something.

Well, this has been a major waste of 
time.

And here I thought all the noise BTC 
bars have made lately would be useful for 
something.
You don't know?

You'll find out soon enough. Don't 
worry.

In any case, I guess I'll have another 
drink and leave.
I'll have a Grizzly Temple.

Okay then. This is going to be deducted 
from the $80 from earlier, right?
Fine...
Wrong! Not paying for this!
Come on! There has to be something.
This week has been slow as hell.

The only good thing I've heard is about 
this girl who threw herself off the roof of 
a nearby mall.

And the whole thing about a woman 
catching her mid-air makes me think it's 
totally made up.
Dammit!
Wait... who told you that?

Yeah, but the name "The Harbingers" 
wasn't used.

No Glitch City outlet has reported that 
themselves.

There are rumors that someone or 
something is keeping them silent.

And even the international outlets 
aren't using the name "Harbingers".

They're avoiding acknowledging the 
organization yet, for some reason.

So you're either one of them or somebody 
in the know told you about it.
Really?!

I mean, sure. I can't think of anything 
that would be useful involving him right 
now, but...
Did he talk about anything interesting?
I see, I see... that's...

Sounded like something very heavy being 
dropped.

No, you could clearly hear the clashing 
of metal.

Something that was both made out of 
metal and very heavy fell down. That's 
what made the sound.

I heard there were some gang spats 
going on. Maybe they took the conflict here.

Well, I've got to go. Seems coming here 
wasn't a waste of time after all.

Really. I just have different needs. But 
there will come a time when this place might 
help me.
Goodbye.

What would a kid like you know about 
that, eh?

Yeah, if by enhanced, you mean getting 
yanked around by a shiny new chain around 
our necks.

Can't you see that those big companies 
don't care about us?

Why do you think Glitch City is 
mockingly called "the guinea pig of the 
world"?

We're just one big test group for them 
to use however they want!

But then again, I don't expect a kid to 
understand how hard it was, let alone a rich 
kid.
Like what?

Yes, but we also hold the AI Reformation 
Program.

Meaning that we're also the world's 
Lilim prison.

AI went rogue? Transfer it to a delivery 
drone or ship it to Glitch City.

That murderer is now delivering your 
pizza.

And the gap between classes continues 
to grow.

More companies just mean more people 
who will plant their feet on your face.

It's amazing, for those who can afford 
them.

Meanwhile, down here we're experiencing 
medicine shortages almost every month.
More jobs? Shut up.
Well, that's...

Hey you! Don't just sit there. Give me 
a Zen Star!
God, this is awful.

Hey, this tastes better than I 
expected.
Huh...

I seriously hope you don't really 
believe everything you just said.
Yeah, mature. Whatever.

I haven't been able to find much, but 
I can at least tell you that she wasn't 
at the bank when it opened up.

Either she left before the whole 
ordeal started...

...or she managed to escape at some 
point before the whole thing ended.

All the corpses are accounted for. They 
only found one totally disfigured, but 
witnesses identified it.

It wasn't your friend, that much is for 
sure.

The weird part is that the girl did 
enter the bank. It's like she... vanished 
or something.
Me? Um...
Just get me whatever you order.

Imagine a guy shows up and tells you "I 
made a classy Bad Touch", wouldn't you line 
up to slap him?
What?!

Turns out she was at the Apollo Trust 
Bank all this time. No wonder I couldn't 
get in touch with her.

Someone paid me to look for Crimson 
Rose and she happened to be at the...
Um...

I'm trying to avoid mentioning that a 
dangerous assassin got stuck in the same 
bank as the girl you're looking for.
Are you sure?
Okay then. I'll have a Piano Man.

So this is what drinking something 
classy without worrying about the price 
feels like.
This is sweeter than I imagined.
Just like when my daughter was born.
This is different from what I remember.

Alright, I should get going. My contact 
will arrive at the rendezvous point soon.

I'll let you know if I find out 
anything else, Ms. Hoshii.
Right, then.

Well, that's it for me. Good night, 
Miss Hoshii.
Mister Art... that sounds weird.
I'll have a Beer.

There's no better way to end a crappy 
day at work.

Not really, just that my job's crappy 
in general.

What is this? An unwashed glass that 
used to have Beer and that you poured 
water on?

Listen, even I know this isn't a Beer. 
Not paying!
Wait, did you just say "Miss Stella"?

When you entered, you asked for Miss 
Stella.
Would it happen to be Stella Hoshii?

Huh... that was quite the coincidence. 
I'm actually doing a job for her.

"Stella" is not exactly a common name. 
So of course I'll raise an eyebrow when 
hearing it.

Tracking some missing girl that was 
in the Apollo Trust Bank on the weekend.

That's the weirdest thing. She wasn't 
among the dead bodies and yet she is 
nowhere to be found.

I like to think she found a way out, 
but I must keep investigating.

Crimson Rose? Nope, but I did find out 
she was stuck with the other people at the 
Apollo Trust Bank.

She disappeared too, and honestly, she 
better stay that way.

There are things I certainly don't wanna 
deal with, and an assassin whose cover has 
been blown is one of them.
That girl is... unstable. Crazy.

Saying "She was there because she found 
the idea of being in a soon-to-be murdered 
crowd FUN" isn't far fetched.

Apparently not only is she hurt, she 
also got her cover blown.

A wounded beast on the run. Something 
I'm seriously not getting involved with.
I don't care how much they offer me.

On a side note, get me a Marsblast, 
please.
You sure this is right? This isn't red.

You sure this is a Marsblast? It's a 
tad... sweet.
Ah, I see.
...you're weird, kid.
This isn't a Marsblast, Miss Bartender.
Don't expect me to pay for it.
You remember the last time I came?
Yeah, well. I have to.

I don't want the client to come back 
looking for their cash when they realize 
I'm not looking for Crimson Rose.

Do you know how Crimson Rose kills her 
targets?

Her blood has an abnormal batch of 
nanomachines.

They react to the "normal" kind floating 
inside you and I.

If her blood touches yours, it causes 
nanomachine rejection almost immediately.

Right then and there, spreading as fast 
as your blood pumps.

She never executes her targets. She just 
cuts them, cuts her palm and holds the 
target's injury tightly.

Some say the target looks like it's 
getting drained. Getting thinner by the 
minute.

Like I said, as far as I know, that 
girl's cover got blown during the whole 
bank affair.

She got crazy with bloodlust and killed 
a guy or something.

When everyone was freed, she just 
disappeared, probably until the smoke blows 
off.

And there're also hints that she got 
some sort of injury.

So she's likely going to be more on 
guard than usual.

And do you honestly think I wanna chase 
someone so dangerous in such a situation? 
I'm not an idiot.

If my client wants someone dead, they 
can get someone else to take the contract. 
I have a family, dammit.
Wife and a daughter, why?
I get that a lot.
Alright, one last drink before leaving.

Hm... a Piano Man or something with 
lots of alcohol, I'll let you decide.
A Piano Man...

Now that I think about it, why don't 
you have a pianist? That would bring 
clients.
This Piano Man seems off.

Well, the drink can identify itself 
however it wants, I won't judge.
Yup, just like this.

I've had this headache for a bit and I 
wanted to see if alcohol would calm it.
No luck
Thank god I'm leaving...
Aight... tiiiiiiiiime to leave.
Whatcha lookin' at?

Bullshit! I'm moving, you're moving, 
the damn floor is moving like crazy.

I'm just waiting for it to take me out 
the door.

Was it Tanhausser Cabs? Yeah, I'm 
banned from their services.

Too big of a tab, I'd always get into 
one of their cabs and then jump out of the 
window to avoid having to pay.

Don't worry. I'll just go to my office 
and sleep it off. It's nearby.
Yeah, yeah...

Alright then, I'll just take my leave 
now.

Right now, I don't need anything like 
that. Otherwise I would've been pestering 
you from the moment I entered.
Yeah, yeah...

Glass.text:
Oi! Whatcha lookin' at mate? Imma 
hook ya in yer gabber.

Jamie.text: Back.
Ah, hello Jill.
Something wrong?
Oh.
I'll pass.
Greetings.
Sorry, if I may interject...
Most certainly not.

Jill, please. You make me sound like 
a savage.

It would be like me saying that you 
get people drunk for a living.

It's not wrong, but there are better 
ways of saying stuff like that.

And like I said, I'm not looking for 
a fight.

I just noticed you seem to like strong 
drinks.

Well, to be honest, it's a rare sight 
in this bar.

I'd even come to believe I'm the only 
one here who enjoys them, aside from the 
owner.

May I suggest you try a "Suplex" next 
time? It might be to your liking.
Call me Jamie. And you are?
I did, actually.
The second one.

It's easier to remain undetected when 
they have no means to track you or your 
activity.

You lie in a pressure chamber and they 
give you a special IV solution.

It causes Nanomachine Rejection while 
giving you the antibodies needed to prevent 
them from getting back in.

For five hours you're trapped in bed 
while a horrible pressure builds up in 
your body, and nanomachines are forced out.

They're like little needles all over 
your body.

You feel them in your eyes, in your 
gums, in your toes... everywhere.

And after all that, they need to 
implant you with a mechanism that constantly 
releases the same antibodies.
This is a Gut Punch.

Inside, like all other maintenance 
systems.

It can be troublesome at times, but 
the perks of not having nanomachines in the 
body outweigh the cons.

Over time, either by getting a 
much-needed enhancement or through fixing 
injuries.
Nice meeting you, Ingram.
Seemed like a nice guy.
Maybe you caught him on a bad day?
Good evening Gil.
Sure, no hurry.
Hello, young lady.
Nice to meet you, Dorothy.
Oh, I couldn't let you do that...

I suppose it'd be impolite of me to 
reject...
Sure, I'll take your offer.
I'll be fine with just a Gut Punch.
I'd rather not.
All in order. Thank you, Dorothy.
And thank you Jill.

I feel bad about having the big drink. 
Do you want some, Dorothy?

Seems so. Perhaps, it's nice to have 
a change.

You shouldn't be rude with your 
clients, Jill.
You don't seem too upset about it.

Hm? You want to repeat that in front 
of a mirror?
I... don't know how I should react.

Hey Dorothy, may I ask you 
something... ah, private?
No, thank you. It's not about that.

Is it true that the DFC-72 line leaves 
tracking nanomachines in the other person 
after... well...
...*ahem* Yes.
Care to explain?
I see.
Sure, go ahead.

Just enough that my skin still heals 
over time.

I'll tell you that and nothing more, 
young lady.
That girl's something else, huh?

I apologize if I'm taking time from 
your break.
You're no problem, Jill.
Can you make me a Marsblast?

Bitter and mind-numbing. Just like 
war.

Life's a war we fight every day, 
Jill.
Not to an official one, at least.
Wrong astral body, Jill.

You know, years ago I met the lead 
engineer of the moon cannon.

A bit cocky. He said he started the 
project to pick up girls.

Apparently he always told them he'd 
name it after them.

Seems it was *this* close to being 
called the Simonetta cannon instead of the 
Selene cannon.

Mercury... it was such a mystical 
metal ages ago.

That would cause liver failure, 
mercury poisoning, and brain death.
Just enough.

Not really. There's maybe two girls 
and three guys, myself included. Why?

Hm... can you give me the guy's 
name?
None taken.

I don't behead my targets - it's 
too messy.

If they ask me for its head, I 
generally just give them the whole body.
But that story sounds familiar...

I think I know the guy that handled 
that job.

If it's who I think it is, then it's 
a fellow who goes by "Sanders".

To tell you the truth, I don't 
remember my real name.

It might as well be Jamie for all I 
know.
Something wrong?
None taken.

It was easy because I know you won't 
do anything with it.

I wouldn't be so open about that with 
anyone else.
Something wrong?
What could that be?
Thanks a lot.

Well... first of all, I try to keep 
everything as clean as possible.

Second, I don't come here looking for 
trouble, so I don't raise suspicion.

And finally, you can thank your boss 
for easing my mind about other folks.

I've seen what she's done. I feel 
safe here.

She could take care of things if I 
went haywire.
Don't mind that.

I heard she lost her original 
fighting a cyborg wrestler that had gone 
rogue.
Just a rumor, though.
Have you tried asking her?
They're believable because she's her.
You should. It's quite the show.
Thank you, Jill.
R-Right, I was telling you...
Good evening, Jill.

Did you see the news about the Apollo 
Trust bank?

From what I heard, there was a 
commotion earlier today.

Something about people being unable 
to leave the building.
Let's hope for the best.
I see. I guess the bunny was late.
Give me a Marsblast.
Yeah, this is the one.
No problem, just be careful.
Did the news distress you, Jill?
Hey, who's this girl?
Thanks for the advice.

I heard that a supersonic drone was 
undergoing tests and lost its course. That 
might be it.
Ah, I see...

Sonic booms are not sounds people can 
normally identify.

And this one drone made a lot of noise 
when breaking the sound barrier.

It's not. Which makes the whole thing 
quite suspicious..
Are you worried about him?
He can be a troublesome man, huh.
I was working a contract, actually.

But the target's inside the Apollo 
Trust bank. Figured I'd simply leave him 
be for now.
Yeah.

I can tell you that it appears to be 
part of a power struggle somewhere.

They usually don't live long enough. 
I also don't like it when a target who's 
seen my face manages to survive.
What happened?
I'd reject the contract.

I don't ask the name of many people, 
you know. And I always remember those whose 
names I've asked.
They're real in my eyes.

I like to know them better and, to 
some extent, I care about them.
I need that because otherwise...

...nothing you should concern 
yourself with.

But don't worry. Unless you suddenly 
find yourself caught in the middle of a 
power struggle...

The only way I see you becoming 
tangled up in that kind of mess is if you 
find yourself too involved with gangs.
The world can be a dark place, Jill.

This isn't the first time a bank has 
closed like that, but something is... off 
about this.

I don't know. Maybe it's the hour. 
Maybe it's the fact that the news is 
making an unusually big stink out of it.
Let's hope I'm just overthinking it.
Are you worried about something?
I'll take my leave here, actually.

I've still got business to deal with 
even if my target's trapped in a bank.
Take care, Jill.

Yeah, I can make time for one more 
drink.
Fetch me a Beer. Let's keep it simple.

I once read that Beer played an 
important part in humanity's history.
You seem to know a lot about this.

Jill, this isn't Beer. You can't let 
your worries cloud your judgement or the 
quality of your work.

Jill, have you ever thought about 
brain uploading?

I was thinking, what's the point of 
uploading yourself if you're still "here"?

Let's say you upload yourself and, 
effectively, that new someone's in 
cyberspace. You will still be "here".

Wouldn't it be weird to know that 
there's a you that's not you somewhere?

There's more. Imagine placing multiple 
copies of you in different situations.

Exposing each one to different 
scenarios to see how they develop.

I remember an article from a while 
back about the earliest forms of brain 
uploading.

It would scan the brain in such a 
thorough and intense manner that it would 
effectively kill the person.
It used the words "burn the brain".

All for nothing because the data would 
be corrupted or broken.

They halted all brain uploading 
research after that.

I think they started another project 
about living brains in jars or something 
after that.

It makes for a nice time sink when 
I'm doing nothing.

Have you ever felt like your sanity 
has slipped right by you?

Truth be told, neither have I. But 
I'm afraid of it happening.

I don't know. I just have the 
lingering fear that at some point 
I won't be myself.

I'll go crazy, I'll wake up a 
stranger to myself and I won't care...

It's just an irrational fear that 
lingers in me and there's nothing I can do 
about it.

Like the fear of cockroaches for some 
people.
Something like that.

Sometimes I wonder if uploading my 
brain would solve all those problems.

I'll have to wait until it's safe, 
then...
Good point.
That's pretty much it, yeah.
Hm... you might have a point there.
Hm... that's a good question.

It's not like I'm an amnesiac or 
anything like that, but many parts of my 
past seem to be blurry or vague.

I can remember my parents but not 
their names.

I remember I went through compulsory 
education, but not what I studied in 
college

...or, for that matter, if I even 
went to college at all.

I seem to have had a fairly normal 
past, but I get the sense that something 
happened along the way.
Not really, no.

I am who I am right now and that's 
all that matters to me.

I won't go putting feelings where 
there aren't any.

I have this theory that it's all from 
back when I got expunged from nanomachines.

Something must've hit my brain and 
made things blurry.
Not quite damage, but almost.

Well then. Nice talking to you, 
Jill.

Say hello to Gillian for me when he 
comes back.
Ah Jill. Gillian isn't here I see.
I'm fine, don't worry.
Fore?
Ah, I see.
The usual Gut Punch.

I thought when someone ordered a Gut 
Punch, you had to make a joke...

...about giving the client a punch to 
the stomach or something.
Really?

Like when the dictionaries added fake 
words to spot if someone else just copied 
all of it?
Why not tell him that?
Yeah, this'll do.
Seems you're distracted too.

Nothing you should think about too 
much.

It's like those times you just feel 
uneasy for no good reason.

I like to see what I do as bounty 
hunting actually.

The only jobs I don't take are those 
where I have to deal with people who just 
happened to be in the wrong place.

There are some people willing to pay 
to off someone that has done no wrong.

Things like killing someone that owns 
a house in the way of some building, or a 
nosy reporter.

I'm not better for turning a blind 
eye to such requests, but I'm not gonna 
be the one dealing with those.

If I'm sent to kill someone that has 
done something like stealing or killing and 
I get paid for it...
You could see it as bounty hunting.

It's just cheap justifications for 
killing people though. In the end they're 
cheap.

However, I won't be one to kill for 
petty reasons like those.

But let's change the subject here. 
I'll have something bitter if you don't 
mind.
Ah yes...

Bronson roots have more nutrients per 
gram than most vitamin supplements.
Your grandpa knew what he was doing.
This is close, yeah.

Sure, if I put my mind on it I might 
feel the Bronson taste but...

It seems I always manage to make 
you uncomfortable, Jill. Sorry.

Unlike with sex ed, it's better 
that you stay that way, mind you.

Taking lives is not something you 
should get used to.

Ah yes, I know a good way to change 
the subject a bit.

Would you like to hear about the most 
dangerous bounty hunter in the city?

You see, there was actually a 
bounty hunter organization in this city 
not too long ago.

Law enforcement would put a price 
on a dangerous person's head and pay 
for the proof of that person's death.

There was a guy everyone called Jet 
Black James. He got the nickname because 
he always wore black clothes.

The interesting thing was that the 
black clothes were there to hide blood 
stains he got from his contracts.

His tracking skills were top-notch, 
his information network was the best.

Some even joked he would finish 
the bounty within half an hour, or 
he wouldn't take the reward.
...he was too good, in fact.

At one point he took all bounties and 
didn't take a single reward. He was just 
that crazy by then.

The last bounty that the 
organization ever posted was on James' 
head.

The police had him cornered. His last 
words were "Send it all to my account" 
before shooting himself.

A registered bounty hunter was 
charged with many counts of manslaughter 
using his old targets as proof.

If somebody else tried to recreate 
the organization, the seed of doubt would 
grow in little to no time.

What guarantee is there that such an 
organization wouldn't actually be a trap?

They could use the registered 
bounty hunters to take care of the 
most bothersome criminals...

And then dispose of the bounty 
hunters by pressing charges using their 
targets as evidence.

So... no. Jet Black James made sure 
that no law enforcement organization is 
able to set up bounty hunting of any kind.

Ever since then, anyone crazy 
enough to be a bounty hunter works 
independently.

I've actually had those suspicions 
I'm telling you about since the day I 
heard such a thing exists.
Glad to know I wasn't just paranoid.

The name James is pretty common, 
Jill.

Besides, if I remember correctly, his 
real name was actually Theodore.

That story left my throat a bit 
dry. Get me a Beer, please.

One of mankind's oldest friends. 
Cheers.
It... tastes watered down.

Jill, get your mind out of that story 
and focus, please.

One obvious thing I see is that you 
don't take the use of the word "kill" in 
your stride the way Gillian does.
That's good.

It's interesting though. When I 
compare you two, it's obvious Gillian has 
seen quite the share of traumatic stuff.
Where is he, by the way?
Yeah, maybe.
Well, I've got to go.

Send my regards to your boss and 
Gillian.

Lexi.text: Excuse me, is this the Valhalla Bar?
Actually, I'm looking for...
There she is.

Don't worry. I'll just have a drink 
in the meantime.
So, you're Jill?

I've been keeping in touch with Dana 
ever since she left Neo-San Francisco.

She always talks about you, about 
her sister, about her friend in Panama, 
about her sister...

About her sister and about this dog 
she picked up from the street.

Yeah, I think she called him 
"Gillian".

Yeah, she told me he appeared at the 
door looking very pitiful.

And she always talks so happily 
about how he opens up to the people around 
him.

She's even asked me for help finding 
where he came from.
Did you hear something outside?
Hm... let's try the Fringe Weaver.
Seems right. Thanks.
Something's not right here...
Take your time.

Well, I guess it's been almost 7 or 
8 years since I last saw her.

She had a brief stint with me at the 
Neo-San Francisco Police Department.

Well, she was more of a... 
collaborator.

Everyone in the department 
acknowledged her abilities and she helped 
us from time to time.

She was authorized to come with us 
but couldn't act by herself.

She didn't have a gun or a badge, but 
she did have a radio to stay in touch.

And, I'm not gonna lie, she was one 
of the best backup partners I've had over 
the years.

She once took down a band of punks 
with nothing but a loaf of bread.

She requested that the next loaf 
have sesame seeds. Something about it 
hitting harder.

Her old league, the Grand Slam 
Fighters, was fighting against the NSFW.

I was there because I needed to ask 
the owner of the league a couple of 
questions.

But then a fight broke out. Many 
drunkards joined the fray not too long 
after.

I was gonna start evacuating the 
place, but before I knew it, she had 
already subdued the troublemakers.

I asked for help with the rest of 
the case. One thing led to another...
Nah, she's not that kind of girl.

I'm in the middle of some 
investigations, actually.

Nah, I'm not in the police anymore. 
Just a simple private investigator.
Fair enough.

You wouldn't by any chance have heard 
about a group called the "Swap Spiders", 
would you?
Don't worry.
Say, let's try this... Sugar Rush.
Yeah, this is what I've heard about.

Something's not right... but at 
least you aren't serving me spoiled milk.

Calm down. You don't need to overdo 
it.
We're not dating anymore.
She was too Dana.

Friendly reminder that

Leaders of VR adult

You know, I was expecting you

You're not gonna tell me that

Throw me a bone here. There

Yeeeeeeeeeeeeees?
Keep going...
Oh, man...
Bravo! Bra-vo!

Touching! Full of feeling!

So, what happened to that 
finger?
Even while bathing?

So... Any kinky stories you

A client that paid you with

Okay, maybe not here, but

Fiiiiiiine. What about your 
clients, then? Some must've told you some

On one hand, I'm feeling so

On the other hand, YOU'RE NOT 
MAKING MY JOB ANY EASIER!

Don't you have like... a 
really stacked friend that's willing to

That would at least mean some

Look, I don't know. Maybe, 
you've got nice legs, but they don't mean

Okay, this is getting stale. 
I'm gonna heat this up this even if I have 
to do it myself.

We need to drop a cow in here. 
Ms. Bartender, get me drunk. I don't care 
how, just... do it.
Lightheadedness...
Clumsy tongue...

Palms sweaty, knees weak, 
arms spaghetti...
Can't feel my legs...
Can't feel my legs!!

Heheh... alright, let's get 
it on with the lewd stuff!

First, I'll try to guess 
your bust size.

I must warn you, I have a 
90% success rate with this.
Hm... I'd say...

B! Not big enough to fill a 
hand but not small enough to make you look 
like a child.
You're a size B, right?

Don't be like that. I can 
tell you're B-cup.

Your attitude makes me think 
you're an S, and your behavior makes me

So? How many did I get

AAAAAAGH!!! Please let me get 
on with this. I need you to cooperate if

Finally!

Heheheh... I guess it is kind 
of redundant...

Because you see, I'm drunk 
24/7.

Knowing people want to watch

Seeing the viewer count

It's a feeling that neither

Go Premium or go home!

You'd be surprised by how 
many are actually turned on by that.
Everything's written here.

People believe it is and 
I've yet to be troubled by a lawyer.

It's funny, though. When 
you're on the street, unless it's somebody

But learn their name and 
suddenly they're a fucking snowflake

Huh, this is weird. I'm

Because I haven't felt

A week.

Weeks are the ones with 30

If you'll excuse me...
...zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

Nope. A bit hot, but not 
lightheaded. Then again, I'm always hot.

Your drinks are either too 
light or I'm more resilient to alcohol than

Okay, let's try this from a 
different angle. You ask the questions.

I don't know, I'm not the 
bartender. Do your bartender-ish thing.

See? That's what I'm talking 
about. You're the bartender here, bartender.

Anyway, have you ever done 
something reckless or stupid because of

Well, it used to be that I 
very rarely succumbed to such problems.

I was the type to never take 
risks or try new things.

Every time I did, I was 
scolded rather than praised.

What point is there in doing 
this stuff if nobody acknowledges you did

But some time ago I stumbled

talking.
Nothing risque or noteworthy.

She invited me on, and... 
well... the comments were intoxicating.

The internet is a big place. 
Somehow I found within those comments 
people that acknowledged me.
They encouraged me, even!.

After that stream, I tried 
doing some by myself.

I turned on the camera, put 
on something cutesy and started dancing to 
*Kira* Miki.

At first, I pretended the 
camera wasn't there but as soon as I saw 
the comments...
Something snapped within me.

Lewd comments, praises, the 
usual random stuff...

After seeing so many people 
interested in me, I started moving a lot 
more. No more shyness for me.

After that I started doing 
more. I sang, I cooked, I drew things, I 
even did a striptease at some point.

Whenever I was streaming, I 
stopped being shy.

So, at some point I said, 
"Hey, this is the way I wanna live all 
my life".

And thus Streaming-chan was 
born.

Not really. It's not like I'm 
acting or anything. I'm just being myself.

I do need to mind camera 
angles and that kind of stuff sometimes,

And when do I need to mind 
that? For only $99.99 a month you can find 
out. Go Premium, Go!

...hey! You're good at this

you've made me say.

Like, seriously. What's your 
secret?

How do you get people to 
talk?

So it's not a conscious trick

Hey, now that you mention

Pretty interesting stuff.

Well, no wild night tonight. 
But it did get interesting enough.

Anyway, I should go. But 
before I leave, what's your name, Ms.

Alright, Ms. Smithee. Thank

Whoa! The floor is

*grumble* Mmmmm... 
Premium...

VR... can't believe I'm...

...*mumble*

NNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN... hm?

...and neither my pants nor

Evening? Oh well, it's the

Sorry for all the trouble I

You're so nice, flat bartender~
Thanks for taking care of me. Bye!

Hello, guys and gals! 
Streaming-chan's back in action with her

AAAAAAAAAH!! THE MOON! IT 
BURNS!!

Taylor.text: Good evening.
Let's see... I'll have a Green Fairy.

BLUE FAIRY! Sorry, the Absinthe bottle 
distracted me.
I'll have a Blue Fairy.
Nice, yeah. This is the thing.

Listen, I don't have eyes but I can 
still see and that's not what I ordered.

And eat. I have the same system Lilim 
do.
Call me Taylor. Just... Taylor.

And yes, a cutie like you can ask 
me anything.

You have to be the first person I've 
met that didn't go "Okay, Just Taylor".

I'm sure not a hologram, of that 
I'm sure.

Yup, I'm a bonafide human brain in a 
jar.

What? Does my handsomeness make you 
speechless?

Fear not! For I have a speech 
prepared for these situations.

You're seeing one of the 5 Great 
Living Bottled Brains of the world.

We are brains living in conditions 
that allow us to exist as any other 
humanoid creature.

All while computers in our jars scan 
our activities.

In a slow but steady manner, we are 
helping the world understand the inner 
workings of nature's most complex computer.

Not out of exasperation or anything 
like that, mind you.

I just wanted to have something 
thoughtful prepared.

Look! I even have a couple of 
pamphlets with me.
You want one?
Oh, I'm from around here, actually.

I just wanted to take a walk for the 
first time in... quite a bit of time.

Sadly, no. Otherwise I'd remember a 
cute face like yours.

Speaking of which, can I have your 
name?
Jill? That's a really cute name.

It didn't stop you from coming here 
either, did it?

It's gonna take more than cryptic 
but ominous news to stop me.
Sorry, does that bother you?

While I was alive, my body got to a 
point where there wasn't much I could do.

This new state of existence allows 
me to accomplish more than I ever could 
before.

Plus, I'm doing something that'll 
help people in the long run.
Wouldn't you be happy?
Do you wanna make me happy, Jill?
Don't worry. Just give me a Beer.

Ah yes... no matter what happens, 
Beer's always good.

I guess you didn't want to make me 
happy, eh?
I'm sorry if I annoyed you.
You were?
I've thought about that too.

Do you think the you in the 
cybernetic environment would feel like she 
was indeed transferred?

Like, would she remember everything? 
Like waking up someplace else and so on?

One of the brains is being used in 
such an experiment, actually. They can make 
a functional Lilim.

Unfortunately, the wiring and other 
such stuff makes it look more creepy than 
anything.

They aren't transferring his 
identity or anything though. Just wiring him to 
a body.

I have to admit the whole brain thing 
does look creepy.

But the body I'm telling you about is 
just uncanny-looking.

It was quite a shock, actually. It 
didn't last too long, though. I never was 
too attached to my body.

Later in my life, that was almost 
literal.
You can ask anything you want.

Hm... that's actually quite the 
question.

Especially considering I don't really 
know the answer either.

I mean, I remember my name WAS 
Taylor.

In fact, I remember every detail of 
my life, but that the one thing's that's a 
bit blurry.

Yeah, the team that put me here said 
that it might be a side effect of the whole 
process...

But my family and friends say that 
even in life I didn't put too much thought 
into questions about gender.

So, in the end we're back to square 
one.

To be honest, I've chosen to not 
look too deeply into my old identity.

Partly because I'm happier in this 
ambiguous state.

But also because I have this gut 
feeling I'm not psychologically prepared to 
see what I looked like.

I don't know... I feel like if I do 
I might... crumble.
By my name.

If you absolutely need to use 
pronouns, refer to me like you'd refer 
to any other house appliance.
A TV or anything like that. An "it".

In the end, even if I can speak, 
I'm just an object.

That's actually something I've 
internalized a long time ago. Even with 
my original body.

If that doesn't make you comfortable, 
feel free to use neutral pronouns.

To be honest, you can refer to me 
however you want. I don't really pay mind 
to that.

You know what the downside to this 
body is?
I can't get drunk.

If you wanted to drink alcohol for 
the taste, there are many alternatives.

Drunkenness is part of the whole 
experience.

Yeah, but in their case, their 
brain's a computer attached to their body.

Getting drunk causes their brains to 
reduce the input speed to their bodies.

Depending on the model, their "drunk-
subroutine" might throw in a different 
behavioral cycle, even.

It's hard to get drunk when the 
whole point of you being in a jar is figuring 
out exactly HOW you work.
Why, hello there, beautiful.

You hurt my feelings with that, 
darling.

Oh, don't worry about it. At least 
you're not running or fainting.

Your name was Alma, right? I'm 
Taylor.
Say, Alma. Can I buy you a drink?

Hm... I know just what to strive for 
then!

Just kidding. It'd make me happy to 
make you happy by buying you a drink. Does 
that bother you?

Awesome! I'll pay for your next 
drink then.
I'm fine, actually.
I don't wanna drink that much.
Hope you enjoy it.

Hm? Do you not like Alma, Jill? You

Judging from the way you two talk, 
I'm guessing you've been a client here 
for a while now, right?

Really? One would think it's been 
longer.

So, you just started coming here 
and that was it?

It's always good to see a nice 
friendship.

Sadly, it's getting late and I've 
gotta go.

I'll leave you two lovely ladies 
alone. See ya!

Fore.text:
Hey, you're not a spring chicken 
yourself, you know.

Brian.text: Excuse me, I'm looking for Dana Zane.
Tell her it's Brian.
It's alright. I'll wait.

It's not so weird when you're BTC's 
Regional Manager in these parts.

Haha! Don't worry, I know who I'm 
dealing with.

I'm not a fan of people treating me 
too nicely because of my position anyways.

Handle me like I'm just another 
client.

Let's go with the basics. A Sugar 
Rush, please.
Yeah, this one's nice.

They're like the Fried Eggs of 
mixing drinks.

They're the most basic thing, but 
people can still mess them up.

Sugar Rushes are simple enough that 
you only need to follow instructions.

If you can't even do that, your future 
as a bartender is not bright.
Hm...

We've received reports of some 
CaliCOMPs suffering a bug where the names of 
the orders don't match up with the recipe.

Are you getting that too by any 
chance?
You're Jill, right?

Dana has talked quite a bit about 
you.

And I guess you must have a few 
questions for me, am I right?

Mostly concerning the closure warning 
Valhalla got.

I shouldn't, but you have the right 
to know.
Don't mention it. Now where to start...

You saw the news on the information 
leaked during the Apollo Trust Bank 
incident, right?

Turns out the White Knights weren't 
the only ones with shady people.

Some of those same folks have been 
trying to elude legal problems using BTC-
certified bars.

The BTC bars have their own protocols, 
meaning the White Knights can't dig too 
deeply...

...at least, not without going through 
a ton of paperwork first, giving the 
criminals time to cover their tracks.

Although it takes a bit of time to set 
up, it has apparently proven an effective 
method for money laundering.

"Young" bars are the ones under the 
radar right now, and the modest-to-low 
income ones are the primary suspects.

It's not just Valhalla. Any small bar 
with small income is being investigated 
heavily right now.

Among the reasons a bar can get axed, 
low sales is the rarest one.

If low sales were a problem, lots of 
bars would close every year.
Sorry?

If it helps, I'm doing my best to 
appeal in your place.

Most of Glitch City's bars are a pain 
in the ass. They constantly give reports of 
chemical damage or shady drinks.

This is one of the few places from 
which I almost never receive complaints.

The closest thing to a recent 
complaint was that whole Farmer Fabrics 
affair from a little while ago.
I wouldn't get my hopes up though.

Especially since the BTC will try to 
save face by axing as many suspects as 
possible.

Now that I remember, the recipe book has a 
drink created here, right?
Get me one of those, please.

The registry form said this was an 
accident while making a Piledriver.
Ah, so you're Robert?
Jill called you "Gil" though.
Huh... I see.

No, I think you got it wrong. The 
Suplex is a variation of a Piledriver.
This is just a Piledriver.

It happens to even the best of us. 
Let's leave it at that.
Jill... this isn't...
Oh well, leave it at that.
I'll be right there.
Any other questions, Jill?
Yeah?

Clean and timely delivery of the 
correct orders. A top-notch bartender.
Now if you'll excuse me...

You could use a bit more practice to 
not mix up one drink with another, but 
you're pretty good aside from that.

Now, I need to go talk to your Boss. 
Excuse me.

Eh... I need to talk to your Boss, 
excuse me.

Alright then. That would be all, 
Dana.

Quite a mess, the situation with... 
um... Robert.
Right, right...
Oh! If it isn't Miss Hoshii herself.

I didn't expect to see you here of

Are you busy? Mind catching up for a 
bit?

Y-Yes, Dana. Your sister is certainly 
cute. Can I leave? PLEASE?
Thank god...

A pleasure meeting you Jill, same to 
you err... Robert.
